title: A Modest Proposal: Letâ€™s Send the People Whoâ€™ve Been Destroying America to Alcatraz
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Alcatraz. AL-ca-traz. Three unforgettable syllables. A name to conjure with.
For me at least, the first thing that springs to mind when that word rolls off my tongue is the minor rock band that served as a springboard for two of the most iconic guitar shredders of the 1980s: Yngwie J. Malmsteen and Steve Vai. But that was Alcatraz with a double Z, and thatâ€™s just me.
Today Iâ€™m talking about Alcatraz with a single Z: the federal prison of legend. The lonely rock in San Francisco Bay where, from 1934 to 1963, some of Americaâ€™s most notorious prisoners were sent. The place where Al Capone, Machine Gun Kelly and the Birdman all did long stretches; the place where, if you tried to escapeâ€”and dozens didâ€”the great white sharks patrolling the freezing waters would get you if the guards didnâ€™t. That Alcatraz. The name means â€œpelicanâ€ in Spanish, apparently.
Since its closure in 1963, Alcatraz has been a national park and a very popular tourist attraction, but now it looks like it may be set to return to its roots as a correctional facility for the worst kinds of criminals America has to offer.
On Sunday, in a post on Truth Social, President Trump announced that he had instructed various parties, from the Federal Bureau of Prisons to the FBI, to reopen the prison, so that the â€œdregs of societyâ€ can once again be â€œkept far away from anyone they could harm.â€ Doing so, the President said, will help establish that the United States of America is once again a â€œserious nation.â€
â€œFor too long, America has been plagued by vicious, violent, and repeat Criminal Offenders, the dregs of society, who will never contribute anything other than Misery and Suffering,â€ the President wrote.
â€œWhen we were a more serious Nation, in times past, we did not hesitate to lock up the most dangerous criminals, and keep them far away from anyone they could harm. Thatâ€™s the way itâ€™s supposed to be.
â€œThat is why, today, I am directing the Bureau of Prisons, together with the Department of Justice, FBI, and Homeland Security, to reopen a substantially enlarged and rebuilt ALCATRAZ, to house Americaâ€™s most ruthless and violent Offenders.â€
Unsurprisingly, President Trumpâ€™s modest proposal has been met with ridicule by his Democrat opponents in- and outside the state of California.
Nancy Pelosi, who was born when California was still part of Mexico and Alcatraz was home only to a load of birds with massive beaks, said it was not a â€œserious proposal.â€ Governor Newsom said, via his spokeswoman, â€œLooks like itâ€™s Distraction Day again in Washington DC.â€
Aptly named state senator Scott Wienerâ€”the guy who takes a very keen interest in age-of-consent law when heâ€™s not marching for gay pride in his leather harness and jockstrapâ€”accused Trump of wanting â€œto turn Alcatraz into a domestic gulag right in the middle of San Francisco Bay.â€
â€œIn addition to being deeply unhinged, this is an attack on the rule of law. Putting aside that Alcatraz is a museum & tourist attraction, this is both nuts & terrifying,â€ he Tweeted.
Civil rights attorney Scott Hechinger called Alcatraz a â€œdomestic torture complexâ€ and said if Trump really wanted to do something about serious crime, he wouldnâ€™t have cut â€œnearly $1 billion from bipartisan, proven, successful anti-crime, violence prevention programs around the country.â€
And smug know-it-all Brian Krassenstein did some rough calculations and then said something smug.
â€œAt least $175-250m just to shore up crumbling concrete, retrofit for earthquakes, and install 21st-century security tech. Operating costs that never stop bleeding. Everything, water, food, fuel, must be barged in, and raw sewage barged out. That pushes the annual budget to 3Ã— a comparable mainland prison, roughly $70 â€“ 75 M every single year,â€ he Tweeted, smugly.
Sure, the island has no fresh water sourceâ€”millions of gallons had to be brought in by barge each week to serve the hundreds of guards and prisonersâ€”and sure the whole place is in need of more than a lick of paint, but money shouldnâ€™t be the main consideration here. Itâ€™s about sending a message.
Many of the most heinous criminals in the US are foreign-born, and the Trump administration is in the process of deporting them all. A good number of them, members of the Latin American gangs Tren de Aragua and MS-13, are being sent somewhere far, far worse than Alcatraz: the Center for Terrorist Confinement (CECOT), in El Salvador, under a $6 million deal with President Nayib Bukele. CECOT is, if I recall correctly, the largest prison in the world, and itâ€™s full of people who torture, rape and murder for funâ€”all in huge communal cells with beds that look like shelves in a vast Amazon warehouse.
Rather you than me, Kilmar!
Getting those scumbags out of the country is by far the best and most economical option.
But that still leaves plenty of homegrown criminals and, in particular, a class of people whose crimes are so uniquely bad they demand a uniquely bad form of punishment.
Iâ€™m talking about the people responsible for the terrible mess America finds herself in today, the architects of American decay. The people Donald Trump was elected to vanquish forever. America Last. Globalists. Call them what you will.
I donâ€™t need to tell you who these people are, and I donâ€™t need to rehearse their crimes. We all know who they are, what theyâ€™ve done, to whom and for how long.
Put them all on Alcatraz and the cost will justify itself, a thousand times over.
Put Anthony Fauci in a cell with Big Mike and once the lights go out, the good doctor will understand something of what it feels like to be a small helpless mammal in one of his heinous NIH-funded experiments. Fauci will wish he was a beagle with sandflies eating his eyeballs instead.
It wonâ€™t happen, of course. The Constitution forbids cruel and unusual punishment. And, nine years later, weâ€™re still waiting for Trump to make good on his 2016 promise of locking up Hillary Clinton for her manifold crimes. But thankfully, the Trump administration is hard at work destroying these rotten peopleâ€™s rotten legacyâ€”deporting millions of illegals, gutting bloated partisan bureaucracies, bringing to an end the enormous edifice of anti-white racial discrimination, preventing the sexual mutilation of childrenâ€”which is punishment enough, I suppose.
My prediction: Trumpâ€™s idea to re-use Alcatraz as a penitentiary will just quietly be forgotten. Iâ€™d call that a missed opportunity, but oh well.

title: Trump AGAIN Says He Will â€˜Walk Awayâ€™ From Ukraine Peace Talks
author: By Sean Miller
content:
On NBCâ€™s â€œMeet the Pressâ€Â Sunday night President Donald Trump reiterated prior statements by him and Vice President JD Vance that the U.S. is ready to â€œwalk awayâ€ from the Ukraine peace negotiations if progress fails to be made. Sundayâ€™s statement is notable as the prior statements have all been made before the signing of Washingtonâ€™s mineral deal.
â€œI do believe weâ€™re closer with one party. And maybe not as close with the other, but weâ€™ll have to see,â€ Trump said. â€œFive thousand soldiers a week on average, are dying. Theyâ€™re not American soldiers. But I want to solve the problem.â€
The â€œMeet The Pressâ€ interview was conducted for Trumpâ€™s first 100 days in office. The President recently got his mineral deal signed by Kiev and is now looking to end the war or cut his losses as he moves into the next phase of his presidential agenda.
The White House has already ordered Moscow and Kiev to begin direct peace negotiations with each other. The day prior, the Kremlin announced it is ready for direct negotiations with Ukrainian Dictator Vladimir Zelensky.
It appears the only holdup for peace is Ukraineâ€™s Dictator.
The U.S. is sending more air defense systems to Ukraine, likely to protect the new U.S.-backed mining operations as part of the mineral deal.
The defensive missile systems are not designed for offensive attack and are likely necessary for safe mineral extraction operations due to the countryâ€™s Dictator opting to keep his war going while Trump tries to recoup Washingtonâ€™s financial losses that paid for Zelenskyâ€™s military losses.

title: Romania: Right-Wing Candidate Wins First Round of Presidential Election After Entire Election Canceled And Top Candidate Banned
author: By Staff | Remix
content:
With over 94 percent of the votes counted, George Simion, of theÂ ultra-nationalist Alliance for the Union of Romanians (AUR) has won the first round of the Romanian presidential election by nearly 40 percent.
With over 3.3 million votes or nearly 40 percent, George Simion is in first, followed by the joint candidate of the governing coalition parties, Crin Antonescu, with 1.7 million votes, or 20.94 percent, and independent candidate NicuÈ™or Dan in third place with 1.6 million votes, or 20.12 percent.
According toÂ Mandiner, if Crin advances to the second round, he may have a chance at winning the post of president, with NicuÈ™or less likely to prevail.
Simion won almost all of Romania, except areas of Szeklerland where many ethnic Hungarians live. In Harghita, MureÈ™, Covasna, Satu Mare and Bihor counties, Crin Antonescu is in first place, while NicuÈ™or leads in Cluj-Napoca county with 95 percent.
The second round of the Romanian presidential election will be held on May 18.
The original first round was annulled last December by Romaniaâ€™s Constitutional Court, citing foreign interference and illegal campaign financing that undermined the fairness of the election and the equal opportunities of the candidates.Â The move was sharply criticized as anti-democratic.
The winner of that first round, independent CÄƒlin Georgescu (previously of the AUR) was disqualified after the top court ruled, with no evidence, that Russia backed Georgescuâ€™s candidacy.
Moscow has denied any involvement; however, after Georgescu was banned from running again in March,Â Kremlin spokesman Dmitry PeskovÂ told a news conference, â€œAny election held without him will be illegitimate. The will of the Romanian people has been suppressed.â€
At the time, George Simion, president of AUR, announced a parliamentary strike on social media, declaring that all AUR MPs would cease attending parliamentary meetings, calling Georgescuâ€™s disqualification â€œan attack on democracy.â€
After the Romanian Constitutional Court rejected the appeal of the ruling by the Central Electoral Bureau, Simion posted on X: â€œToday, the masters have decided: no equality, no liberty, no fraternity for Romanians. Long live France and Brussels, long live their colony named Romania.â€

title: White House Deputy Stephen Miller Slams â€˜Transitioningâ€™ Children as â€˜Child Tortureâ€™
author: By Calvin Freiburger | Lifesite
content:
(LifeSiteNews) â€” White House Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller said on Thursday that â€œgender transitionâ€ procedures on minors amount to â€œchild torture,â€ which the Trump administration is â€œcoordinating with state and local law enforcement to fight.â€
â€œIf a five-year-old or a six-year-old goes to school, or a seven-year-old goes to school, and the teacher â€¦ tries to turn the boy into a girl or the girl into a boy, that is child abuse, and this administration is treating that as child abuse,â€ Miller said at a White House press conference. â€œAnd it is a gross violation of parental rights.â€
.@StephenM: "It is CHILD ABUSE to change a child's gender â€¦ Castration surgeries, castration drugs, sterilization treatments of children are barbaric. They violate all sound medical ethics. They are completely unwarranted. They harm children for life â€” irreversibly." pic.twitter.com/AMNM6eXTau
â€œCastration surgeries, castration drugs, sterilization treatments of children are barbaric. They violate all sound medical ethics. They are completely unwarranted. They harm children for life, irreversibly. It is child torture, it is child abuse, it is medical malpractice,â€ Miller went on, touting the administrationâ€™s efforts to deny federal funds to entities that continue them.
â€œWe are using every single legal and financial tool we have at President Trumpâ€™s direction to make it clear that schools and universities are and will lose federal funds, as youâ€™ve seen in Maine, if you allow men to invade womenâ€™s sports and womenâ€™s spaces,â€ he declared.
AÂ significant body of evidenceÂ shows that â€œaffirmingâ€ gender confusion carries serious harms, especially when done with impressionable children who lack the mental development, emotional maturity, and life experience to consider the long-term ramifications of the decisions being pushed on them, or full knowledge about the long-term effects of life-altering, physically transformative, and often irreversible surgical and chemical procedures.
Studies find that more than 80 percent of children suffering gender dysphoriaÂ outgrow it on their own by late adolescenceÂ and that â€œreassignmentâ€ procedures fail to resolve gender-confused individualsâ€™ heightened tendency to engage in self-harm and suicide â€“ andÂ even exacerbate it, including by reinforcing their confusion and neglecting the actual root causes of their mental strife.
ManyÂ oft-ignoredÂ detransitionersÂ attest to the physical and mentalÂ harmÂ of reinforcing gender confusion, as well as to the bias and negligence of the medical establishment on the subject, many of whom take an activist approach to their profession and begin cases with a predetermined conclusion in favor of â€œtransitioning.â€
Since returning to office, Trump has taken multiple executive actions to reverse the Biden administrationâ€™s transgender policies, including an order thatÂ endsÂ all federal support for â€œtransitionâ€ procedures on minors, rescinds or amends all of the Biden health bureaucracyâ€™s past endorsements of underage â€œtransitioning,â€ and calls for a review of the medical literature on the subject, enforcing all existing restrictions on underage â€œtransitioning,â€ and taking regulatory action to â€œendâ€ the practice to the greatest extent possible under current law.
Another orderÂ prohibits males who claim to be female from competing against actual women in sex-specific athletic programs at schools receiving government funding. A thirdÂ disqualifiesÂ gender-confused individuals from military service and prohibits military health services from conducting â€œtransitionâ€ procedures, although that has beenÂ temporarily blockedÂ by federal courts.

title: FDA To Monitor Vaccine Injuries in Real Time To Ensure â€œTransparencyâ€
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Vaccine injuries will be monitored in real time, in an attempt to ensure greater â€œtransparencyâ€ over vaccines.
The new system will use electronic patient records to ensure more accurate and swift reporting of injuries associated with the use of vaccines.
The system will allow the sharing of data between healthcare providers, hospitals, clinics and other authorized providers. It will flag unusual patterns, such as unusual clusters of conditions like myocarditis, and allow health officials to respond to them more quickly and effectively, itâ€™s hoped.
A spokesperson for the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) said the new surveillance system â€œwill accurately measure vaccine risks as well as benefitsâ€”because real science demands both transparency and accountability.â€
On his first day in office, HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. vowed to address vaccine safety, after claiming that the current Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS) only captures 1% of all vaccine injuries.
In March, Secretary Kennedy announced the creation of a separate agency within the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to focus on vaccine injuries.
At an event in Indian last month, Kennedy said it was â€œoutrageousâ€ that vaccine injuries are not monitored more closely.
â€œItâ€™s outrageous that we donâ€™t have a surveillance system that functions. â€¦ Weâ€™re going to find out what contributionÂ vaccinesÂ and everything elseâ€”mold, [electromagnetic fields], food, all of these other exposures [that] began in the late 1980s â€” which one of those are the culprits [for Americaâ€™s chronic-disease crisis]? I suspect weâ€™re going to see that thereâ€™s a lot of culprits, but we need to know.â€
In related news, Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.Â has instructedÂ the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to begin a â€œscientific processâ€ to look for treatments other than vaccines for measles.
The Department of Health and Human Services issued a statement in which it noted that, although vaccination is still the â€œmost effective way to prevent the disease,â€ Â â€œwe recognize that some individuals and communities across the U.S. may choose not to vaccinate.â€
â€œOur commitment is to support all families â€“ regardless of their vaccination status â€“ in reducing the risk of hospitalization, serious complications, and death from measles.â€
â€œSecretary Kennedy will be enlisting the entire agency to activate a scientific process to treat a host of diseases, including measles, with single or multiple existing drugs in combination with vitamins and other modalities,â€ the statement continues.
â€œThis effort will involve collaboration with universities nationwide to develop protocols, conduct testing, and pursue approval for new uses of safe and effective therapeutics that meet the highest scientific standards.â€
In a newÂ measles treatment overviewÂ posted on its website, the CDC says that â€œvitamin A may be used under the supervision of a healthcare providerâ€ and that â€œother therapies, such as antibiotics should be prescribed based on clinical judgement by an individual healthcare provider.â€
The overview also suggests the use of inhaled steroids as a treatment.
Secretary KennedyÂ has been on the receiving endÂ of sharp criticism from long-term supporters for his newfound advocacy of the measles vaccine.
At the beginning of last month, he Tweeted that Â â€œThe most effective way to prevent the spread of measles is the MMR vaccine.â€
â€œWhatâ€™s the point of writing an entire book about dangers of long term side effects of untested vaccines if you arenâ€™t going to mention it once in power?â€ one Kennedy followerÂ wroteÂ in response to the post.
â€œYou really make a great poster boy for Big Pharma. So much for â€˜MAHA.â€™ GROSS,â€Â wroteÂ another.
Even Kennedyâ€™s very own health nonprofit, Childrenâ€™s Health Defense, which he founded and served as chairman of, distanced itself from him.
â€œWhat he says does not speak for Childrenâ€™s Health Defense in any way at this point,â€ said the organizationâ€™s CEO Mary Holland.
Some suggested Kennedy was being blackmailed.
A multistate measles outbreak centering on west Texas has now reached 800 cases.

title: â€˜Just Being Right-Wing is Not Forbiddenâ€™ â€“Â Influential Mayor of TÃ¼bingen And Former Green Party Member Criticizes German Government Actions Against AfD
author: By Staff | Remix
content:
The influential mayor of TÃ¼bingen, Boris Palmer, is harshly criticizing the Office of the Protection of the Constitution (BfV), the powerful German domestic spy agency, after it labeled the Alternative for Germany (AfD) a confirmed â€œright-wing extremistâ€ party. The former Green Party politician, who won TÃ¼bingen despite switching to run as an independent, said the secret, 1,000-page report used to justify the AfDâ€™s designation basically just listed public incidents already known to the media.
â€œUnless DerÂ SpiegelÂ is simply poorly informed, the Office for the Protection of the Constitution has compiled primarily what is publicly known,â€ wrote Palmer.
In addition, the report seems to focus on the AfDâ€™s stance on migration, but Palmer himself says it is no surprise the AfD is critical of immigration.
He noted that there are vast differences in rates of violence between different regions of the world, and also within Germany, it is clear that some groups are more prone to violence than others, including groups like Afghans and Algerians. However, he argues that this is socially and not genetically determined.
â€œTerms like â€˜knifemenâ€™ are political exaggerations, but not evidence of racism,â€ he wrote.
â€œJust being staunchly right-wing and anti-immigration is not forbidden,â€ he added. â€œAfter all, the law of blood was still largely a reality in the Federal Republic of Germany.â€ He said the 2000 reform of the citizenship law improved this situation, which meant children born to non-German parents could still attain citizenship in Germany, â€œbut were Helmut Kohl and Roland Koch enemies of the constitution because they clung to the old law?â€
The report from the BfV could pave the way for a potential ban, but Palmer is also critical of a ban procedure, saying that not only could it benefit the AfD, but that the entire process may be legally questionable with a very uncertain outcome.
He said he cannot imagine that the Constitutional Court, the countryâ€™s top court, would classify the party based on statements it has made about migration and even the concept of Germans as an ethnicity. He said accusations about the AfD being racists, Nazis, or misanthropic are to be expected, but for judges to ban an entire party over it is not believable or constitutional.
Notably, the AfD is now polling in first place for the first time ever, and in some polls has reached 26 percent. It is currently the second-largest party in the Bundestag and the largest opposition party.
The BfV is a highly partisan organization. Run by President Thomas Haldenwang (CDU), he reports to the head of the Interior Ministry, Nancy Faeser (SPD). Both parties have a vested interest in removing the AfD as competition in the democratic process.
Regardless of a ban, the â€œextremistâ€ classification from the BfV is a powerful blow against the party, as it enables the BfV to surveil members with impunity, including chats and emails. It also means civil servants cannot be members of the party, including police officers. In addition, the BfV can now install informants in the party, who can make extremist statements and tarnish the partyâ€™s reputation, all without the AfD knowing who is an informant and who is not. In short, it is a massive tool of intimidation and fear using Stasi-like methods with 21st-century technology, including AI tracking and monitoring.

title: Biden Team Considered Forcing Him To Take Cognitive Test Months Before He Dropped Out of Race
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
President Bidenâ€™s Team wanted him to take a cognitive test months before his disastrous debate performance made it impossible for him to continue in the 2024 presidential race, but then decided against doing so, a new book claims.
2024: How Trump Retook the White House and the Democrats Lost America is authored by Tyler Pager, a reporter for The New York Times, Josh Dawsey, a reporter for The Wall Street Journal and Isaac Arnsdorf, a reporter for The Washington Post, and is due to release in July.
In 2024, the authors detail debates held by top aides months as early as February 2024 over whether President Biden should be made to take a cognitive test.
The book claims the aides were confident he would pass a test, but they believed making him take one would only highlight his age and play into his opponentsâ€™ hands.
February 2024 was when Special CounselÂ Robert Hurâ€™s reportÂ about the former presidentâ€™s mishandling of classified documents was released.
In the report, Hur described Biden as â€œa sympathetic, well-meaning, elderly man with a poor memory.â€
The book also details how Bidenâ€™s chief of staff, Ron Klain, called David Axelrod to remonstrate with him about a New York Times report that quoted Axelrod as saying, â€œThe stark reality is the president would be closer to 90 than 80 at the end of a second term, and that would be a major issue.â€
â€œThat comment prompted an angry call to Mr. Axelrod from Ron Klain, then Mr. Bidenâ€™s chief of staff, according to the book. Mr. Klain wanted to know why Mr. Axelrod was fueling doubts about a Democratic president who was on track to begin a re-election campaign,â€ according to The New York Times.
â€œThereâ€™s no Obama out there, Axe,â€ Klain is reported to have said, adding â€œWhoâ€™s going to do it if he doesnâ€™t do it?â€
Meanwhile, former White House Press Secretary Jen PsakiÂ has claimedÂ she had no idea about President Bidenâ€™s cognitive decline until his disastrous performance in his debate last year with Donald Trump, which led to his exit from the presidential race.
Speaking with Ben Smith of Semafor, Psaki dismissed the notion of a â€œcoverupâ€ of Joe Bidenâ€™s worsening mental state.
â€œI never saw that person â€”not a single time, and I was in the Oval Office every day, that was on that debate stage,â€ Psaki said.
â€œIâ€™m not a doctor. Aging happens quite quickly,â€ she added, before telling her host â€œcoverupâ€ is a â€œvery loaded term,â€ which should only be used to describe crimes.
â€œPeople use that term as related to Watergate. Or the covering up of not sharing public information about a war,â€ she explained. â€œI think itâ€™s a bit of a dangerous term.â€
The final straw for Joe Bidenâ€™s backers was his appalling performance in his presidential debate with Donald Trump.
According to investigative journalist Seymour Hersch, theÂ debate made it impossibleÂ to hide his decline any further, and Barack Obama and Kamala Harris stepped in with a threat to invoke the 25thÂ Amendment if Biden didnâ€™t withdraw from the race.
â€œItâ€™s not surprising that the long overdue unraveling of President Joe Bidenâ€™s re-election campaign happened when it became impossible to keep his increasing impairment covered up,â€ Hersch explains.
â€œIt was the big-time money backers of the Democratic Party who called off the game of see no evil, hear no evil, after Bidenâ€™s shocking performance in his June debate with Donald Trump. They balked at continuing to give millions of dollars to the party now that there was evidence that the president is not always there.â€

title: AfD Says Attack on Party â€œClearly Politically Motivatedâ€
author: By Zolta GyÅ‘ri | The European Conservative
content:
Alice Weidel and Tino Chrupalla, co-chairs and spokespeople for right-wing populist Alternative fÃ¼r Deutschland (AfD) have released aÂ statementÂ in response to the news of the German domestic intelligence agency BfV classifying the party, currently the largest opposition force, as an extremist entity, paving the way for a potential ban.
The decision of the Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution is a severe blow to German democracy!
Weidel and Chrupalla said in a post on X.
+++ Alice Weidel/Tino Chrupalla: "Entscheidung des Verfassungsschutzes ist ein schwerer Schlag gegen die bundesdeutsche Demokratie!" +++Zur ErklÃ¤rung des Bundesamtes fÃ¼r Verfassungsschutz teilen die AfD-Bundessprecher Alice Weidel und Tino Chrupalla mit: â€Die heutigeâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/k8bPjekrcg
The conservative politicians questioned the legitimacy of the decision, since the current administration is only four days away from stepping down. â€œThe federal government only has four days left in office, the intelligence agency doesnâ€™t even have a president anymore. And the classification as a so-called suspected case is not yet legally binding,â€ read the statement.
The co-chairs said the party is being â€œdiscredited and criminalizedâ€ just before the imminent government change, suspected to be a move trying to break the momentum of AfD that has been gaining ground in Germany in recent months.
Weidel and Chrupalla pledged to fight the decision, saying: â€œThe AfD will continue to defend itself legally against these defamations that endanger democracy.â€

title: Trump Says Mexican Pres. â€œSo Scared of the Cartels She Canâ€™t Walkâ€
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum is â€œso scared of the cartels she canâ€™t walk,â€ President Trump has said, as he confirmed that he did indeed offer US military assistance to fight the cartels in Mexico.
Sheinbaum spoke at a university event on Saturday and addressed aÂ Wall Street JournalÂ report that claimed President Trump has been pushing for greater US military involvement in fighting the cross-border drug trade.
â€œIn one of the calls, (Trump) said, â€˜How can we help you fight drug trafficking? I propose that the U.S. Army come in to help you,â€™â€ said Sheinbaum.
â€œAnd you know what I told him? No, President Trump, the territory is sacrosanct, sovereignty is sacrosanct, sovereignty is not for sale, sovereignty is loved and defended.â€
Sheinbaum added that, although Mexico and the US should collaborate against the cartels, â€œwe will never accept the presence of the United States military in our territory.â€
In response to Sheinbaumâ€™s claim, President Trump told reporters on Air Force One on Sunday that he had indeed offered to send â€œtroops into Mexico to take care of the cartels.â€
Trump said that Sheinbaum is â€œso afraid of the cartel she canâ€™t walk,â€ but added that he believes the Mexican president is â€œa lovely woman.â€
â€œShe is so afraid of the cartels she canâ€™t even think straight,â€ he added.
At the start of his second term, President Trump imposed a 25% tariff on Mexican goods in an effort to force the Mexican government to deal with the cartels and their role in the cross-border drug trade and illegal migration.
In February, the US government designated a number of Mexican cartels as terrorist organizations, in a move designed to enhance the range of options available for dealing with them, including the use of military force.
Aerial surveillance of the cartels has since been increased, as well as intelligence-gathering efforts.
In response, President Sheinbaum has proposed constitutional reforms to bolster Mexican national sovereignty.

title: Conservative Polish Presidential Candidate Meets With Trump, Will Celebrate May 3 With Polish Community in Chicago
author: By Staff | Remix
content:
Karol Nawrocki, president of the Institute of National Remembrance (IPN) and PiS presidential candidate, met with U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House during his visit to the United States, which will include celebrating Polandâ€™s Constitution Day on May 3 with the Polish community in Chicago.
Aside from his talk with Trump,Â Do RzeczyÂ reports Nawrocki, an independent who scored support from the conservative Law and Justice party (PiS), exchanged words with various officials in the Rose Garden during the National Day of Prayer ceremony. He was seen speaking with Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Speaker of the House of Representatives Mike Johnson, WH Chief of Staff Susie Wiles, and Secretary of Health Robert Kennedy.
The PiS candidate is also expected to discuss defense, energy contracts, and the stationing of American troops in Poland with members of Congress.
Nawrockiâ€™s sit-down with Trump in the Oval Office is said to have been a surprise.
â€œPresident Donald J. Trump welcomes Polish presidential candidate Karol Nawrocki to the Oval Office,â€ the official White House account posted on X.
â€œGreat meeting with POTUS. It was an honour to discuss the bright future of Poland-U.S. relations,â€ Nawrocki posted on his own account.
Chicagoâ€™s May 3rd Day Parade, first started in 1892, celebrates the ratification of the Polish Constitution of May 3, 1791. This yearâ€™s slogan will be â€œ1000th Anniversary of the Kingdom of Poland.â€Â  The largest Polish parade outside of Poland being in Chicago makes sense, as the city is home to the largest Polish population in a metropolitan region in the U.S. With more than 720,000 residents claiming Polish heritage, it is purportedly the most Polish city in the world outside of Poland.

title: Houthi Missiles Hit Ben Gurion Airport: Israel Mulls Iran Strike in Response
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
A missile fired by Houthi rebels in Yemen hit Israelâ€™s Ben Gurion airport on Sunday, prompting suggestions from within Israel that the country could retaliate against Iran, the Houthisâ€™ main backers.
Six people were injured by the strike, none seriously. The missile landed in the grounds of the airport, in a grove of trees.
Surveillance camera footage showed the moment the missile struck.
The Israeli military said attempts were made to shoot down the missile, including with a US THAAD system deployed to the country, but they all failed.
Israelâ€™s main airport was closed for several hours as a result.
The attack is the first time a Houthi missile directed at Israel has hit Ben Gurion. A Hezbollah missile hit the airport in November, damaging a parking lot.
Mohammed al-Bukhaiti, a senior Houthi official, told an Arab TV channel that the rebel group had shown it is capable of hitting sensitive targets in Israel. He said the group has â€œno red linesâ€ in its fight against Israel.
After the attack, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu held a meeting with Defense Minister Israel Katz and other top defense officials to examine potential responses.
In a short statement following the attack, Katz said, â€œWhoever harms us, we will strike them sevenfold.â€
The opposition National Unity party chairman and former defense minister Benny Gantz called on the government to hold Iran directly accountable for the attack.
â€œThis is not Yemen, this is Iran. It is Iran that is firing ballistic missiles at the State of Israel, and it must bear responsibility,â€ Gantz wrote on X.
â€œThe Israeli government must wake up,â€ he said, arguing that fire on Israel â€œmust lead to a severe response against Tehran.â€
The Houthis began attacking Israel and maritime traffic in November 2023, a month after the 7 October Hamas attack.
The United States has intensified her airstrikes in Yemen against the Houthis in recent weeks, targeting their leadership and infrastructure. President Donald Trump has warned that Iran will be made to pay the price for Houthi missile attacks.

title: Trump To Reopen Alcatraz for â€œMost Ruthless and Violent Criminalsâ€
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Alcatraz will be reopened to house the â€œmost ruthless and violent criminals,â€ President Trump announced on Sunday.
In a post on Truth Social, the President said he was instructing the Bureau of Prisons, Department of Justice, FBI and Department of Homeland Security to reopen the notorious prison, which housed some of Americaâ€™s most infamous criminals.
â€œREBUILD, AND OPEN ALCATRAZ! For too long, America has been plagued by vicious, violent, and repeat Criminal Offenders, the dregs of society, who will never contribute anything other than Misery and Suffering,â€ President Trump posted.
â€œWhen we were a more serious Nation, in times past, we did not hesitate to lock up the most dangerous criminals, and keep them far away from anyone they could harm. Thatâ€™s the way itâ€™s supposed to be. No longer will we tolerate these Serial Offenders who spread filth, bloodshed, and mayhem on our streets. That is why, today, I am directing the Bureau of Prisons, together with the Department of Justice, FBI, and Homeland Security, to reopen a substantially enlarged and rebuilt ALCATRAZ, to house Americaâ€™s most ruthless and violent Offenders. We will no longer be held hostage to criminals, thugs, and Judges that are afraid to do their job and allow us to remove criminals, who came into our Country illegally. The reopening of ALCATRAZ will serve as a symbol of Law, Order, and JUSTICE. We will, MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!â€
Alcatraz served as a federal prison from 1934 to 1963, and housed inmates like the gangsters Al Capone and â€œMachine Gun Kelly.â€ Alcatraz Island is currently a national park.
According to the prisonâ€™s official government website, â€œOfficials sought to create a new, unique prison for those deemed difficult to incarcerate elsewhere in the federal prison system. A remote site was sought, one that would prohibit constant communication with the outside world by those confined within its walls. Although land in Alaska was being considered, the availability of Alcatraz Island conveniently coincided with the governmentâ€™s perceived need for a high security prison.â€

title: â€œFar Rightâ€ Candidate Winning Romanian Election
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
â€œFar rightâ€ populist candidate George Simion is winning the first round of the Romanian presidential election.
Exit polls have put Simion in first place, followed by centrist candidates Crin Antonescu and Nicusor Dan, who are neck and neck for second place.
The presidential election was originally held in November, but the result was annulled after right-wing populist Calin Georgescu won a shock victory in the first round with 23% of the vote.
Romanâ€™s Constitutional Court annulled the victory, citing â€œirregularities.â€ It was claimed Georgescu had received help in his campaign from Russia.
In March, Georgescu was barred by the Central Electoral Bureau from running again, on account of his allegedÂ â€œanti-democraticâ€Â andÂ â€œextremistâ€Â stance as well as a failure to comply with electoral procedures.
Eleven candidates are competing for the presidency. The key contenders include George Simion, the leader of the Alliance for the Union of Romanians (AUR), who is known for his opposition to the EU and NATO, as well as criticism of military support to Ukraine.
Other prominent candidates include Crin Antonescu, representing the governing Social-Democrat and National Liberal coalition, and Nicusor Dan, the mayor of Bucharest, both of whom support pro-EU agendas.
If no candidate wins an absolute majority in the first round, a run-off between the two leading candidates will be held on May 18.
Ahead of the rerun, meanwhile, Romanian detained RT journalist Chay Bowes, who had traveled to Bucharest from Dublin, Ireland, to cover the election. According to the reporter, he was told he wasÂ â€œa threat to the security of the stateâ€Â and therefore should be deported. Bowes, an EU citizen, has insisted that he entered RomaniaÂ â€œcompletely legallyâ€¦ to do [his] job.â€

title: Trump Officials Rip New York Times for Hiding Immigration Status of Illegal Alien Arrested for Raping Corpse in NYC Subway
author: By Dan Lyman
content:
Top officials in the Trump administration tore into the New York Times for publishing a story about a suspect arrested for raping a dead man in a New York City subway car without mentioning that he is an illegal alien.
On Thursday, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) revealed the immigration history of Felix Rojas, 44, who allegedly performed horrific sexual acts on the body of a man who died inside a Manhattan subway car last month.
Rojas was apprehended last Sunday and charged with rape and grand larceny in connection with the attack,Â which unfolded on April 8.
The Timesâ€™ coverage of the arrest, published on April 28, refers to Rojas merely as a â€œBrooklyn man,â€ and has not been updated to include the fact that he is a Mexican national who has illegally entered the U.S. at least five times since 1998.
Instead, the paper focused on his reputation as â€œpart of a churchgoing family with three childrenâ€ who â€œdid not have a criminal history and was not listed on the stateâ€™s sex offender registry.â€
On Saturday, DHS Assistant Secretary Tricia McLaughlin ripped the Times for refusing to â€œmention anywhere in its 400-word story on the monstrous rape of a corpse on the NYC subway that the depraved perpetrator is an ILLEGAL alien.â€
â€œWhy not report the facts, NYTimes?â€
The New York Times refused to mention anywhere in its 400-word story on the monstrous rape of a corpse on the NYC subway that the depraved perpetrator is an ILLEGAL alien. Why not report the facts, @nytimes? pic.twitter.com/O5IzCMfyEe
Stephen Miller, White House Deputy Chief of Staff for Policy, also blasted the outlet and the mainstream media at large for running cover for dangerous illegal aliens.
â€œWhether itâ€™s â€˜Brooklyn Manâ€™ or â€˜Maryland Dadâ€™ the media will always lie to protect criminal aliens,â€ Miller wrote on X on Saturday.
Whether itâ€™s â€œBrooklyn Manâ€ or â€œMaryland Dadâ€ the media will always lie to protect criminal aliens. https://t.co/vB9bdOudsq
More than 150,000 illegal aliensÂ have been apprehendedÂ in the U.S. since President Trump took office, many of whom have serious criminal histories.
