title: Trump Admin: We â€˜Will Not Tolerateâ€™ States Using Gender Ideology to Strip Parental Rights
author: By Calvin Freiburger | Lifesite
content:
(LifeSiteNews) â€“ A Trump administration spokesman said it will â€œnot tolerateâ€ infringements on parental rights, such as a proposal in Colorado to make â€œmisgenderingâ€ potential grounds to remove children in custody disputes.
Named after a victim of the 2022 Club Q nightclub shooting perpetrated by â€œnon-binaryâ€ Anderson Aldrich, theÂ Kelly Loving ActÂ would establish that â€œwhen making child custody decisions and determining the best interests of a child for purposes of parenting time, a court shall consider deadnaming, misgendering, or threatening to publish material related to an individualâ€™s (so-called) gender-affirming health-care services as types of coercive control. A court shall consider reports of coercive control when determining the allocation of parental responsibilities in accordance with the best interests of the child.â€
It would also ban state courts â€œfrom applying or giving any force or effect to another stateâ€™s law that authorizes a state agency to remove a child from the childâ€™s parent or guardian because the parent or guardian allowed the child to receiveâ€ dangerous â€œgender transitionâ€ procedures and has aÂ host of additional requirementsÂ unrelated to custody matters. It has passed the Colorado House but not yet the Colorado Senate.
SpeakingÂ to theÂ Daily Signal, U.S. Department of Education (DOE) spokeswoman Julie Hartman declared that â€œchildren do not belong to the government. They belong to parents.â€
Without announcing any specific action, she added, â€œthe department will not tolerate abuse of parentsâ€™ rights â€” or of students who are victims of predatory behavior by adults who are supposed to protect them.â€
Critics say transgender activists have inflicted a wide array of harms on society, both to theÂ physical and mental healthÂ of gender-confused individuals themselves as well as to the rights, health, and safety of those who disagree, such as girls and women forced toÂ share intimate facilitiesÂ with males, female athletes forced to compete against biological males with natural physical advantages, and individualsÂ forced to affirmÂ false sexual identities in violation of their consciences, their understanding of scientific fact, and/or their religious beliefs.
Since returning to office, President Donald Trump has taken multiple executive actions to reverse the Biden administrationâ€™s transgender policies, including an order thatÂ endsÂ all federal support for â€œtransitionâ€ procedures on minors, rescinds or amends all of the Biden health bureaucracyâ€™s past endorsements of underage â€œtransitioning,â€ and calls for a review of the medical literature on the subject, enforcing all existing restrictions on underage â€œtransitioning,â€ and taking regulatory action to â€œendâ€ the practice to the greatest extent possible under current law.
The Trump administration has alsoÂ frozenÂ Title IX grants to Main over the stateâ€™s potential noncompliance with rules against gender-confused males in sex-specific school athletic competitions against actual females, and openedÂ investigationsÂ into Maine and California for policies related to schools withholding information about a childâ€™s gender confusion from parents.

title: Majority of Germans Believe AfD Will Win Next Federal Election, Poll Reveals
author: By Thomas Brooke | Remix
content:
A new INSA survey has revealed that a majority of German citizens now believe that the Alternative for Germany (AfD) could become the strongest political force in the next federal election.
At the same time, nearly half of respondents say the AfD should be treated like any other party, amid attempts by Germanyâ€™s legacy party to ostracize the populist faction with an ongoing political firewall.
According to the survey, reviewed by theÂ Junge FreiheitÂ news outlet, 51 percent of respondents believe it is likely the AfD will win the most votes in the next Bundestag election. Only 27 percent disagree.
The findings, presented by INSA head Hermann Binkert on YouTube, point to a growing normalization of the AfDâ€™s rise. Alice Weidelâ€™s party became the second-largest party in the Bundestag after Februaryâ€™s election, but its popularity has continued to rise following the election-winning Christian Democratic Unionâ€™s (CDU) decision to team up with the Social Democrats (SPD) to form another Grand Coalition.
Among AfD voters themselves, belief in victory is overwhelming at 87 percent. However, even supporters of traditionally centrist or left-leaning parties express similar expectations: 63 percent of BSW voters and 60 percent of FDP voters also think the AfD could come out on top. Only the SPD and Greensâ€™ bases remain broadly skeptical.
Some 46 percent of Germans say the AfD should be treated like any other democratic party, compared with 33 percent who oppose this. While opposition remains strong among SPD, Green, and Left Party supporters, majorities within the CDU/CSU (49 percent), FDP (63 percent), and BSW (47 percent) now favor equal political treatment for the AfD. Unsurprisingly, 83 percent of AfD voters agree.
The softening of opposition contrasts with the hard stance taken by Germanyâ€™s major Christian churches, which have repeatedly condemned the AfD. However, voter behavior within the religious communities tells a different story.
Among Protestants, 26 percent support the AfD â€” second only to the CDU/CSU (28 percent) and way ahead of the Greens (7 percent). Catholic voters also give 25 percent support to the AfD, with the CDU/CSU again leading at 34 percent. The Greens trail with just 13 percent.
Among non-religious voters, the AfD is the most popular party (26 percent), surpassing the CDU/CSU (19 percent) and SPD (14 percent). Muslim voters, on the other hand, typically show strong support for left-wing, pro-migration parties, including the SPD (37 percent) and the Left Party (25 percent), with AfD support negligible at 5 percent.
A Forsa poll published this weekÂ showed the AfD out in front as the leading party in Germany for the first time in its history, attaining 26 percent, with the CDU/CSU a percentage point behind.
If the vote back in February were held today, the two parties set to enter government, the Social Democrats (SPD) and the CDU, would not have enough seats for their agreed coalition.
BREAKING: ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªThe AfD party is now the most popular party in Germany for the first time ever, soaring to 26%.The main German parties are working to ban the AfD, and a vote on a ban is expected in the coming months in the new Bundestag.Follow: @RMXnews pic.twitter.com/Czf0gJcNgs
The news comes at a time when the left is racing to vote on a ban on the AfD in the German parliament, the Bundestag.

title: Deported â€˜Maryland Fatherâ€™, Kilmarâ€™s Van Full Of Migrants Owned By Convicted Human-Trafficker
author: By ZeroHedge
content:
Last week it was revealed thatÂ Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a deported El Salvadoran man (aka, â€˜Maryland Fatherâ€™) at the center of an intense political debate, was suspected by a Tennessee state trooper ofÂ human traffickingÂ in 2022 after he was pulled over for driving erratically in a black 2001 Chevrolet Suburban â€“ owned by another individual, full of people.
â€œDuring the interview, subject pretended to speak less English than he was capable of and attempted to put encountering officer off-track by responding to questions with questions,â€ reads the summary. â€œWhen asked what relationship he had with the registered owner of the vehicle, subject replied the owner of the vehicle is his boss, and that his work is in construction.â€
â€œThere was no luggage in the vehicle,Â leading the encountering officer to suspect this was a human trafficking incident,â€ according to DHS records.
Now,Â Just the NewsÂ reportsÂ that the SUV was owned by a man who was himself deported after pleading guilty to smuggling illegal aliens in 2020.
Abrego Garcia told the state trooper that the SUV was owned by his boss. DHS documents, meanwhile, identified the owner of the vehicle asÂ Jose Ramon Hernandez Reyes â€“ whose 2001 Suburban was flagged separately by Homeland Security Investigations Baltimore field office as belonging to a target the suspected of human trafficking or smuggling, the documents reveal.
â€œVehicle is used by HSI Baltimore target in human smuggling/trafficking operation. Vehicle makes trips to southern border to pick up non-citizens,â€ reads the record, adding that the Baltimore HSI case agent should be notified if the vehicle is encountered.
Jose Ramon Hernandez Reyes, who Abrego Garcia claimed he was working for,Â had been previously convicted of smuggling illegal aliens into the United States.
In 2020, Hernandez Reyes, himself an illegal alien, pleaded guilty and was sentenced to 18 months in prison for smuggling fellow illegal aliensÂ in the United States after he was stopped by law enforcement in Mississippi in a car with passengers from Mexico, El Salvador and Honduras. Homeland Security records indicate Hernandez Reyesâ€™ â€œdeport orderâ€ was reinstated in March 2021, as his 18-month sentence was nearing its end. -Just the News
A DHS official confirmed toÂ JTNÂ thatÂ the Hernandez Reyes mentioned in both cases refer to the same individual, though itâ€™s unclear what the relationship was between Abrego Garcia and Hernandez Reyes.
According to the report,Â the similarities in traffic stops between the two men are striking.Â According to theÂ DOJ, Hernandez Reyes and one co-defendant were stopped outside in Jackson County, Mississippi in the Suburban, which was being driven by one Modesto Alvarez â€“ later determined to be Hernandez Reyesâ€™ brother-in-law.
Investigators also determined thatÂ the eight of the nine men in that stop were in the US illegally,Â and were citizens of Mexico, El Salvador and Honduras who had previously been deported from the United States and had illegally returned. They wereÂ  charged with unlawful reentry into the country.
Officers determined thatÂ Alvarez and Hernandez Reyes were transporting the illegal immigrants from their home base of Houston, Texas, to different locations throughout the United States. -JTN
Hernandez Reyes pleaded guilty in August 2020 to smuggling illegal aliens, and wasÂ sentenced to 18 months in prisonÂ plus three years of supervised release â€“ after which he was slated to face deportation proceedings which carried a 10-year prison threat if he returns.
In the case of Abrego Garcia,Â he was stopped for driving erratically and speeding, on an expired driverâ€™s license, by a Tennessee state trooper in November of 2022 â€“ similarly transporting a large group of people from Houston, Texas.
Three weeks after the stop, on Dec. 27, 2022, DHS updated its records to urge any personnel who encountered Abrego Garcia to â€œescort to secondaryâ€ â€“ a designation usually applied to someone suspected of wrongdoing.

title: Peter Schiff: Goldâ€™s Rise Is a Warning Everyone Ignores
author: By SchiffGold
content:
In Fridayâ€™s episode of The Peter Schiff Show, Peter sets his sights on the marketâ€™s astonishingÂ complacency in the face of goldâ€™s surge, the misplaced confidence in U.S. trade policy, and the broader implications ofÂ Americaâ€™s debt addiction. He makes the case that the real warning signals arenâ€™t flashing on Wall Street or Capitol Hill, but embedded in the price of goldâ€”while few seem willing to pay attention.
He opens by highlightingÂ one remarkable aspect of goldâ€™s climbâ€”not the price itself, but the collective ignorance around it:
But you know, whatâ€™s more significant even than the increase in the price of gold is the fact that nobody cares. Nobody pays attention. You know, Iâ€™ve said this before, but it bears repeating. When you donâ€™t know thereâ€™s a bubble, you donâ€™t see the pin. And that is something that I came up with during the housing crisis. Because a lot of people, even after 2007, after the subprime market really started to collapse, most people just shrugged it off. They didnâ€™t care. They thought it was nothing.
Peter moves to the unstable environment driving these changesâ€”specifically, the trade warsÂ ignited by tariffs under President Trump. He points out that the expert consensus was flat-out wrong when it came to theÂ consequences for the dollarÂ and the global economy:
Whatâ€™s even more significant is that this is happening during a time of turmoil. Trump basically started it with these tariffs, launched this global trade war, created all this economic uncertainty. No one knows what the hell is going on. Trade is a big part of the global economy. And again, remember, all of these so-called experts predicted that tariffs would cause the dollar to go up. Thatâ€™s why the dollar rallied right after Trump won, because the markets were saying, oh, weâ€™re going to get tariffs, thatâ€™s good for the dollar.
Turning to international affairs, Peter takes aim at the mistaken belief that China is desperate for American consumers. He challenges theÂ narrative of U.S. indispensabilityÂ with a clear-eyedÂ assessment of both nationsâ€™ economic realities:
Iâ€™ve got to counter all the nonsense that Iâ€™m hearingâ€¦ Trump or one of his advisors saidÂ  that China is desperate to make a deal. â€¦ China needs to make a deal because China wants what we have, the American consumer.Â  China wants consumers. Thereâ€™s a billion Chinese. Why would they need consumers? They got more consumers in China than we got in America. Whatâ€™s so special about the American consumer that China needs us?
Reinforcing the theme of economic misunderstanding, Peter spotlights a fundamental error in how government officialsâ€”particularly at the Treasuryâ€”think aboutÂ abundance and scarcity. He uses a simple analogy to question why policymakers seem to prefer an economy of limits, rather than one of overflow:
What is better if you can make more than you need, or you canâ€™t make as much as you need, right? If you make too much food, whatâ€™s the worst thing thatâ€™s going to happen? Some of itâ€™s going to rot. If you donâ€™t make enough food, you could starve to death, right? So what do you want to have, a surplus? Do you want to have abundance or do you want to have scarcity? See, according to the Secretary of the Treasury â€¦ scarcity is better than abundance.
Peter wraps his analysis by returning to the heart of the issue: the United Statesâ€™ addiction to debt and the inevitable consequences of monetary intervention. He warns that weâ€™re heading toward not just another crisis, butÂ a distinctly American reckoningâ€”one that might spare the rest of the world for once:
I mean, that is the bottom line, right, massive QE. We are heading to another financial crisis, only itâ€™s not a global crisis, itâ€™s going to be a U.S. crisis. Weâ€™re going to liberate the world, because theyâ€™re not going to be dragged down, theyâ€™re not going to be buying our dollar and buying our debt. Theyâ€™re going to be taking their money home, keeping their goods for themselves. And so the world is going to be better off keeping its stuff and investing its savings in their own economies rather than giving us their stuff and investing their money here in America.

â€œItâ€™s now time, I think, to take, if not the final step, one of the final steps, which is, at a broad level, the party saying weâ€™re going to stop the killing, weâ€™re going to freeze the territorial lines at some level close to where they are today,â€ Vance said Wednesday. â€œNow, of course, that means the Ukrainians and the Russians are both going to have to give up some of the territory they currently own.â€
ğŸš¨ BREAKING: VP JD Vance says US will "WALK AWAY" if Russia and Ukraine don't come to a ceasefire dealâ€¦"It's time for them to either say 'yes,' or for the United States to walk away from this process.""We've put together a very fair proposal.""It's now time, I think, toâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/OfI63m2LQg
Unfortunately Ukraine appears unwilling to give up any territory, at least while under the dictatorship of Vladimir Zelensky.
â€œ[Crimea] is our territory, the territory of the people of Ukraine. We have nothing to talk about on this topic, it is outside our constitution,â€ Zelensky said Tuesday.
That wasnâ€™t all however, the Dictator even placed the blame on Russia for his own lack of ability to compromise by saying that this is what they want.
â€œAs soon as we start talking about Crimea, about our sovereign territories, we enter the format of prolonging the war,â€ the Dictator said.
While the U.S. partially steps back their involvement mediating the situation in preparation for a full abandonment, U.K. Foreign Secretary David Lammy is hosting a bilateral meeting with a Ukrainian official on Wednesday, although details of what has and will be discussed are not yet clear.

title: Supreme Court Signals Support For Parents Fighting to Opt Children Out of LGBTQIAAP2SN+ School Lessons
author: By Doug Mainwaring | Lifesite
content:
WASHINGTON, D.C. (LifeSiteNews) â€” The U.S. Supreme Court today appeared to be on the side of a diverse group of parents in what promises to be a landmark case concerning parentsâ€™ rights to opt their children out of pro-LGBT school instruction aimed at students as young as three years old and that promotes a one-sided, left-wing ideology on gender and sexuality.
â€œInÂ Mahmoud v. Taylor, the Montgomery County, Maryland Board of Education took away parental notice and opt-outs for storybooks that celebrate gender transitioning, pride parades, and pronoun preferences with kids as young as three and four,â€ explains a statement from the Becket Fund, the attorney group representing a coalition of Muslim, Christian, and Jewish parents.
The books in question were not even intended for use in human sexuality classes but as an integral part of Montgomery County Public Schools (MCPS) English and Language Arts classes.
Even left-leaning Justice Elena Kagan seemed to side with the parents against the MCPSâ€™s drastic opt-out ban forcing young children to be exposed to extreme LGBT and â€œgender identityâ€ material that not only many religious but also non-religious parents would likely object to.
Kagan said she, too, was struck by the â€œyoung kidsâ€™ picture booksâ€ and, â€œon matters concerning sexuality, I suspect there are a lot of non-religious parents who werenâ€™t all that thrilled about this. And then you, â€¦ add in religion and thatâ€™s, you know, even more serious.â€
Fox Newsâ€™ justice correspondent, David Spunt, standing in front of the Supreme Court building said, â€œIt looks like the justices will rule in favor of these parents.â€
â€œThis is not education, this is indoctrination,â€ said Billy Moges, a Montgomery County parent who serves as director of Kids First, in a Fox News interview immediately following todayâ€™s hearing.
â€œThis is not only about religion,â€ said Moges, citing the fact that the parents who have joined Kids First represent many different religions and denominations, as well as atheists. â€œThis is about parents with common sense. No parent with common sense will allow their 3-year-old to learn about sexual behaviors, to learn about sexual body parts.â€
â€œThis is wicked,â€ she added. â€œThis is an attack on children and the family.â€
â€œItâ€™s going to destroy communities,â€ she predicted, â€œAnd when communities are destroyed, the nation will be destroyed.â€
Moges affirmed that she and the other parents who seek to opt their children out of these lessons love, respect, and bear no hatred toward those who support this curriculum, but â€œour kids will not be brainwashed, will not be indoctrinated,â€ she insisted.
â€œThe School Board is pushing inappropriate gender theory on children and running roughshod over parental rights,â€ said Grace Morrison, a member of Kids Firstâ€™s board. â€œToday, we urged the Court to let kids be kids, and let parents guide their religious future. A childâ€™s innocence, once lost, is gone forever.â€
â€œThe new â€˜inclusivityâ€™ books were announced in 2022 for students in pre-K through fifth grade. Instead of focusing on basic principles of respect and kindness, however, the books champion controversial ideology around gender and sexuality,â€ explained the Becket Fund.
According to the original complaint, MCPS â€œclaims authority to introduce pre-K and elementary school kids to certain books (the â€˜Pride Storybooksâ€™) that promote one-sided transgender ideology, encourage gender transitioning, and focus excessively on romantic infatuation â€“ with no parental notification or opportunity to opt out.â€
â€œOne book invites three- and four-year-olds to look for images of things they might find at a pride parade, including an â€˜intersex (flag),â€™ a â€˜(drag) kingâ€™ and â€˜(drag) queen,â€™ â€˜leather,â€™ â€˜underwear,â€™ and an image of a celebrated LGBTQ activist and sex worker, â€˜Marsha P. Johnson,â€™â€ the legal filing noted.
Teachers were also instructed to say doctors only â€œguessâ€ when identifying a newbornâ€™s sex.
The school board revoked notice and opt-outs for these storybooks, which violates Maryland law, the boardâ€™s policies, and the advice of its own elementary school principals.
Parents arenâ€™t the only ones who have expressed concern about the addition of these books to the MCPS curriculum.
Early on, â€œMontgomery Countyâ€™s own principals objected that these books were inappropriate for the age, they were dismissive of religion and shaming toward children who disagree,â€ explained Eric Baxter, Becket Fund vice president and senior counsel, who presented the parentsâ€™ case in front of the Supreme Court justices today.
â€œThe board itself withdrew two of the books for what it said were content concerns, because it finally agreed that what parents and petitioners and its own principals are saying was accurate,â€ said Baxter.
â€œIn this country, weâ€™ve always trusted families to decide when their kids are ready for sensitive topics,â€ said Eric Baxter. â€œChildren shouldnâ€™t be forced into conversations about drag queens, pride parades, and gender transitions without their parentsâ€™ permission. Today, we fought for common sense and parentsâ€™ right to guide the upbringing of their children.â€

title: The AfD is Now The Most Popular Party in Germany For The First Time Ever, All While Debate Rages Over The Party
author: By Staff | Remix
content:
The Alternative for Germany (AfD) has hit a historic watermark, and is now the most popular party in Germany for the first time ever, reaching 26 percent. The poll, from Forsa, shows the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) in second place with 25 percent.
If the vote were held today, the two parties set to enter government, the Social Democrats (SPD) and the CDU, would not have enough votes to enter government. The SPD is at 15 percent, giving the two parties a combined total of 40 percent. The poll showed that support for the Greens dropped a point to 11 percent and the Left Party also dropped a point to 9 percent.
BREAKING: ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªThe AfD party is now the most popular party in Germany for the first time ever, soaring to 26%.The main German parties are working to ban the AfD, and a vote on a ban is expected in the coming months in the new Bundestag.Follow: @RMXnews pic.twitter.com/Czf0gJcNgs
The news comes at a time when the left is racing to vote on a ban on the AfD in the German parliament, the Bundestag, a topic covered in detail by Remix News. However, despite inital reports that the CDU would back such a ban, the picture is becoming muddier.
For one, there are more and more voices in the CDU and its sister party, the CSU, who are calling for â€œmore calmâ€ towards the AfD, including from the influential vice-chairman of the CDU/CSU parliamentary group, Jens Spahn. Spahn even said that the AfD should be able to lead some of the committee in the Bundestag, which would give the party more say and power. Given that it received the second-most votes during the German election, it should, like all other parties, have access to these committees, but many want to shut it out completely, especially from intelligence committees.
The issue could lead to a major split in the coalition between the CDU and SPD. SPD Bundestag member Ralf Stegner toldÂ WeltÂ his party has â€œabsolutely no sense of humorâ€ on any attempt to go easy on the AfD.
ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªğŸš¨ "Germany needs the AfD"Young women are increasingly promoting the AfD party on TikTok.Many of them feel increasingly unsafe in Germany, and they believe AfD is the answer. pic.twitter.com/iXemPYBV0c
He said any kind of rapprochement would represent a â€œmaximum stress testâ€ for the new coalition govenrment.
â€œAnyone who wants to form a coalition with the SPD cannot join forces with right-wing radicals. And joining forces also means voting for enemies of democracy,â€ he said. The MP, known for his left-wing views, instead is calling for a ban on the AfD if the Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution (BfV) classifies the party as â€œconfirmed right-wing extremist.â€
â€œIf the Office for the Protection of the Constitution upgrades its classification, then we also have a duty to work towards initiating a ban on the party,â€ Stegner said.
ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªâ€¼ï¸ Young German woman explains why voters are turning to the AfD"Iâ€™m afraid to travel by train, afraid to go into town, afraid to do anything in public. And they talk about people being afraid of the AfD. The AfD has done nothing to anyone, unlike other people." pic.twitter.com/hYlQVKXb1Q
However, Welt reports that CDU is rejecting an â€œautomoaticâ€ approach to banning the AfD.
The CDU/CSU, in turn, rejects this automatic approach: â€œTo derive an obligation to initiate ban proceedings from an upgrade by the Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution clearly ignores the legal situation,â€ said GÃ¼nter Krings, legal policy spokesman for the CDU-CSU parliamentary group. He instead wants to â€œfight the AfD politically by exposing its extremismâ€¦The best recipe against the AfD is concrete successes by the new federal government, especially in migration, security, and the economy.â€
ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª AfD's Alice Weidel backs mass deportations in party conference speech."I have to tell you quite honestly that if this must be called remigration, then let it be called remigration." pic.twitter.com/lyB8aOBCv6
He also claims that initiating proceedings â€œwould only make the AfD rub its hands together and use it as free support for its victim myth.â€
Meanwhile, the AfD is slamming calls for a ban. â€œThe renewed call for an AfD ban is completely unfounded and would be completely hopeless,â€ said Alice Weidel, the co-leader of the AfD. â€œInstead of engaging in absurd and anti-democratic ban fantasies, Mr. Stegner should be thinking about why his party has been losing voters in droves for years.â€Â Sahra Wagenknecht, who is the leader of the left-wing BSW, told Welt: â€œFirst gigantic electoral fraud, then the ban debate: could it get any more stupid? The fact that such proposals are now coming from the self-proclaimed â€˜democratic center,â€™ of all places, is disgraceful and will further strengthen the AfD.â€
She went so far as to say it was a purely autocratic move.
â€œNo question, in an autocracy, the â€˜problemâ€™ would be solved in exactly the same way.â€
Even in the SPD, there is debate about a ban.
SPD Minister President of Saxony Stephan Weil (SPD) warned a ban could also fail, which would be â€œa feast for the AfD.â€

title: Brussels Doubles Down on Social Media Censorship
author: By TamÃ¡s OrbÃ¡n | The European Conservative
content:
In a clear jab at the U.S.-based social media companies that have put free speech on their banners and allied with the Trump administrationâ€”Meta and Xâ€”European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen warned that Brussels will not let global tech companies get away with disregarding the content moderation rules laid down in the EUâ€™s infamous censorship tool, the Digital Services Act (DSA)â€”regardless of where they are located or who is running them.
â€œThe rules voted by our co-legislators must be enforced,â€ von der LeyenÂ toldÂ PoliticoÂ on Monday, April 22nd.
â€œThatâ€™s why weâ€™ve opened cases against TikTok, X, Apple, Meta, just to name a few,â€ she then went on, before claiming that the political bias had nothing to do with Brusselsâ€™ enforcement of the DSA:
We apply the rules fairly, proportionally, and without bias. We donâ€™t care where a companyâ€™s from and whoâ€™s running it. We care about protecting people.
While itâ€™s true that all of these companies are facing punitive action from EU regulators to a different extent, in most cases, the EU has been floating only â€œmodestâ€ fines of a few million euros so far, and mostly for non-compliance with the Digital Markets Act (DMA), not the much more sinister DSA.
However, the case of Elon Muskâ€™s X is different, defeating the entire â€˜no political biasâ€™ argument.
We reported earlier this month that Brussels is preparingÂ to impose a completely unprecedented â‚¬1 billion fine on the companyÂ at the end of an ongoing investigation into its alleged DSA violations that began in 2023, right after Musk purchased the website and turned it into a cornerstone of online free speech.
Specifically, the case covers Xâ€™s refusal to police and censor â€œunlawfulâ€ contentâ€”anything thatâ€™s deemed â€˜harmfulâ€™ or â€˜disinformationâ€™ by Brusselsâ€”as well as to share its data with external actors, such as researchers, regulators, or â€˜fact-checkers.â€™ Reasonable things, consideringÂ the revelations of the Twitter Files, which many seem to have forgotten.
Meta could soon face a similar situation, as itâ€™s beenÂ hit with the same criticismÂ from Brussels since Mark Zuckerberg ditched his fact-checkers for being politically biased and carrying out the will of the Democratic Party and the various U.S. intelligence agencies in their content moderation.
In other words, American companies that have been actively working to restore and protect the freedom of speech are now being coerced by Brussels to allow the EUâ€™s fact-checkers (the same organizations that were booted by Zuckerberg) to resume their previous censorship work under the DSA.
While von der Leyen may act like all global tech giants are treated the same in Brussels, the mainstream parties in the EU Parliamentâ€™s â€˜Ursula coalitionâ€™ made it abundantly clear earlier this year that their problem is specifically with the â€œtech oligarchsâ€ who aligned with President Trump.
Whatâ€™s more, the alleged disinformation that spreads on X and Meta was named as one of the key reasons the EU is working on the so-calledÂ Democracy Shield, an additional toolbox to help police online content and enforce existing DSA rules.
The EUâ€™s increasingly aggressive stance on free speech-oriented platforms (and U.S. companies in general) didnâ€™t escape the attention of the Trump administration. Back in February, Vice PresidentÂ JD Vance called out the EUâ€™s insistence on political censorship, while the â€œunfairâ€ targeting of U.S. tech giants is a central point of conflict in the escalating trade war between Washington and Brussels.
With everything happening since Trump took office, von der Leyenâ€™s claim that DSA enforcement is not political is simply ridiculous. Perhaps she should start fact-checking herself next time.

title: Stop All Federal Funding of Universities
author: By Connor O'Keeffe | Mises Institute
content:
The Trump administration has found itself in aÂ disputeÂ with Harvard University. It began when the Presidentâ€™s team sent several Ivy League universities a list of changes they expected the schools to make.
The move is part of a new right-wingÂ strategyÂ which recognizes that we currently live under a vague, necessarily politicized system ofÂ civil rights lawÂ and aims to begin interpreting civil rights laws in ways more in line with the values and social aims of the right.
By threatening to withhold federal funds, the administration was able to get schools like Columbia University to agree to enact changes like banning masks, granting campus police more powers, and appointing an administrator to oversee the Middle East Studies Department with the authority to crack down on rhetoric about Israel that the administration considers antisemitic.
Harvard, however, refused to abide by the administrationâ€™s demands. As a result, Trump froze a little over $2 billion in federal funds going to the school last week and announced plans to freeze an additional $1 billion earlier this weekâ€”all while threatening to withhold all $9 billion the Ivy League school receives from the federal government each year if they refuse to agree to the Presidentâ€™s demands.
The showdown is largely being framed as either a battle to protect academic freedom from an authoritarian president or an overdue effort to rescue one of the nationâ€™s oldest universities from the radical far-left administrators leading it off course.
But as politicians, pundits, and university officials battle over which characterization is accurate and, therefore, what ought to happen next, few are paying any attention to one of the more outrageous details that this dispute has brought attention to: that taxpayers are being forced to send $9 billion a year to one of the wealthiest colleges in the world.
The $9 billionÂ figureÂ comes from several federal programsâ€”including education initiatives, student aid, research grants, student loan guarantees, and funding for the universityâ€™s affiliated hospitals. Much of this funding is composed of multi-year grants and contracts, but the annual figure does, indeed, tend to land around $9 billion.
And thatâ€™s just Harvard. Zoom out, and youâ€™ll find that those same federal programs are forcing the over-taxed, heavily-indebted, inflation-rattled American publicÂ to sendÂ well over $100 billion to colleges and universities every single year.
Conservatives and free-market advocates are right to point out whenever the topic of student debt forgiveness is brought up that such a program is, in effect,Â a wealth transferÂ from poorer, working-class Americans without college degrees to their better-off, frequently white-collar, college-educated counterparts. But the same is true for all programs that transfer tax dollars to colleges and universities.
Beyond being blatantly unjust, the federal money pouring into higher education is theÂ main factorÂ behind the exploding cost of college in recent decades. In the name of making college more affordable, the federal government effectively took over the student loan market in the US andâ€”primarily by extending government loan guaranteesâ€”expanded the level of lending far beyond what private lenders were willing to provide.
That created significantly more demand for college, which jacked up the price. Then, the artificially high prices forced even more students to turn to loans to afford school, which required more government loan guarantees, which made prices even higher, meaning more loans were needed, and on and on. All the while, the government has started and expanded direct federal spending programs on education that have only fueled the affordability death spiral.
This has been terrible for every non-wealthy student or family straining to pay for a college degree, and all the people who could not afford to go to college at all who are still forced to fund all the government subsidies causing this mess. But, itâ€™s important to understand, this setup has been great for the universities who have gotten to enjoy filling their campuses with cartoonishly lavishÂ buildingsÂ and resort-levelÂ accommodations, whileÂ bloatingÂ their administrations with diversity officers, sustainability directors, and other ideological positions.
It has also been great for the politicians and government bureaucrats who have gained leverage over the schools educating the next generation and the scholars and intellectuals currently researching topics relevant to those running our federal government.
In other words, federal higher education policy is best understood as one big government-run scam thatâ€™s enriching and empowering a small group of ideological administrators and bureaucrats at our expense. It is, in that way, noÂ differentÂ from the healthcareÂ systemâ€”through which schools like Harvard are also receiving money through their hospitals.
That is the big unspoken truth at the core of this debate about what the Trump administration is doing with Harvard. A president like Trump can exert control over the internal policies of these universities because of how unnecessarily reliant they are on government money. And widespread pushing of highly unpopular progressive dogmas in classrooms and professional scholarship can only happen at this large a scale because of howâ€”and how muchâ€”higher ed and academia are subsidized in modern America.
There is only one genuine and permanent solution to these problems. Halt all federal fundingâ€”direct and indirectâ€”for these â€œprivateâ€ colleges and universities.
As long as these schools rely on politicians to fund their operations, they will always be politicized. There is no escaping that. And, on the other side, even if Trump is totally victorious and gets Harvard to capitulate on everything, there is functionally nothing stopping the next Democrat to win the presidency from reversing everything Trump did.

title: Trump Enters Final Stages of Ukraine Peace Plan, Zelensky Resists Concessions
author: By Sean Miller
content:
On Tuesday it was reported that the United States is mulling recognizing the Crimean region, a coastal area along the Black Sea, as Russian territory. The consideration comes as peace negotiations between Moscow and Kiev, brokered by Washington, are moving into their final stages. Ukrainian Dictator Vladimir Zelensky however quickly came out to say he would reject allowing Russia to keep Crimea. Trump indicated that he will soon give up brokering peace between the warring Slavic nations if his efforts do not result in a deal.
This proposal is expected to be discussed in London later this week with officials of various Western nations. Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Trumpâ€™s special envoy Steve Witkoff and Keith Kellogg are reported to be in attendance, set to meet with foreign ministers and security advisers from France, Germany, the U.K. and Ukraine. Witkoff is also expected to visit Moscow to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin as well. It is however unclear if the Moscow trip will take place before or after the London meeting.
Despite Crimea officially joining Russia via a 2014 referendum vote, Zelensky says he will never accept it. The Dictator said the war will go on until he can have everything he wants.
â€œ[Crimea] is our territory, the territory of the people of Ukraine. We have nothing to talk about on this topic, it is outside our constitution,â€ Zelensky said.
That wasnâ€™t all however, the Dictator even placed the blame on Russia for his own lack of ability to compromise by saying that this is what they want.
â€œAs soon as we start talking about Crimea, about our sovereign territories, we enter the format of prolonging the war,â€ he said.
President Donald Trump said he will be giving details of his peace plan this week.
â€œI will be giving you a full detail over the next three days,â€ Trump said. â€œBut we had very good meetings on Ukraine, Russia â€¦ Weâ€™ll see how that works.â€
The New York Post claimed that â€œone senior administration official told The Post they may include deploying European forces to Ukraine should an end to the war and cease-fire be reached,â€ yet the outlet didnâ€™t specificity who that official was.
One dire detail however is that Trump said he will walk way from the peace negations if no progress is made soon.
â€œDonald Trump has said the U.S. will â€˜take a passâ€™ on brokering further Russia-Ukraine talks if Moscow or Kyiv â€˜make it very difficultâ€™ to reach a peace deal,â€ the BBC said Friday. â€œThe U.S. president told reporters in the Oval Office on Friday that he was not expecting a truce to happen in â€˜a specific number of daysâ€™ but he wanted it done â€˜quicklyâ€™. His comments came hours after U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned that the U.S. would abandon talks unless there were clear signs of progress within days.â€
â€œWeâ€™re not going to continue with this endeavor for weeks and months on end,â€ Rubio said, stating that Washington has â€œother priorities to focus onâ€.
Trumpâ€™s frustration of Zelenskyâ€™s lack of acceptance to peace was on full display in late February when the Dictator went to Washington D.C. and disrespected America in the White House.
The President denied the Dictatorâ€™s request to return to the White House, adding his Ukrainian counterpart must first â€œwant peaceâ€ before negotiations continue.
â€œHeâ€™s got to say â€˜I want to make peace,â€™â€ said Trump. â€œ[Zelensky] doesnâ€™t have to stand there and say â€˜Putin this and Putin that,â€™ all negative things.â€
WATCH IN FULL: President Donald J. Trump speaks to the press on the South Lawn of the White House pic.twitter.com/49lQwAi8dM

title: Massachusetts Proposes Laws to Remove Religious Exemptions, Parental Consent for Vaccines
author: By Suzanne Burdick, Ph.D. | The Defender
content:
Massachusetts lawmakers are considering a bill to remove religious exemptions to school vaccine mandates and two bills that would allow minors to consent to â€œpreventative care,â€ including vaccines, according to grassroots groupsÂ Health Rights MAÂ andÂ Health Action Massachusetts.
Versions of the bill seeking to remove religious exemptions were introduced in the MassachusettsÂ House of RepresentativesÂ andÂ Senate.
Beth Ingham, a leader of Childrenâ€™s Health Defenseâ€™s (CHD)Â New England ChapterÂ since 2022, called the proposed legislation â€œhorrendous.â€
If passed, children whose families object to school-mandatedÂ vaccinationsÂ based on sincerely held religious beliefs would be barred from attending public and private K-12 schools, according to Health Action Massachusetts.
Massachusettsâ€™ lawmakers are also consideringÂ An Act Promoting Community Immunity, a bill that would undermine religious exemptions for school-based vaccine mandates and remove parental consent forÂ vaccinesÂ in some cases.
According to Health Rights MA, the community immunity bill would:
Candice Edwards, executive director ofÂ Health Action Massachusetts, told The Defender that the stateâ€™sÂ Joint Committee on Public HealthÂ will soon announce a hearing date for the two bills.
â€œOnce the hearing is scheduled, weâ€™re asking people to show up in personâ€ to testify about why they oppose the bills. â€œGiven the climate specifically for the removal of the religious exemption, we need an army inside that State House testifying.â€
Additionally, Massachusettsâ€™ lawmakers are considering a third bill that ostensibly aims at â€œenhancing accessâ€ to abortion but would also allow minors to consent to â€œpreventative care,â€ including vaccines, without parental knowledge or consent, the groups said on their websites. Versions of the bill have been introduced in both theÂ House of RepresentativesÂ and the Senate.
According to Health Action Massachusetts:
â€œAn Act Enhancing Access to Abortion goes beyond abortion-related care by granting minors the ability to consent to all forms of preventative care, including vaccinations and sterilization, without parental consent or knowledge. It does not include any age delineations or mental capacity guidelines for minors making these decisions.â€
This third bill is overseen by theÂ Joint Committee on the Judiciary, rather than the Joint Committee on Public Health. Edwards said her organization willÂ alertÂ people as soon as there is any movement with the bill or a hearing scheduled for it.
Commenting on the ongoing fight to maintain the right to religious exemptions and parental consent in Massachusetts, Edwards said, â€œWeâ€™ve been fighting this since 2019, and itâ€™s now become our lives to fight this and be on top of it.â€
Not the first time Massachusetts lawmakers tried to remove religious exemptions
According to Ingham, the latest Massachusetts bills arenâ€™t the first time the stateâ€™s lawmakers have tried to remove religious exemptions. During the COVID-19 lockdowns, lawmakers considered a bill that would have removed religious exemptions.
However, the bill never made it to a full vote due to â€œmassive opposition.â€
â€œIt just kind of fizzled in committeeâ€ after hundreds of people voiced opposition to it during an online hearing, Ingham said.
She recalled:
â€œThey invited people to come online â€¦ for three minutes each, and there were 400 or 500 people online and they let all of them testify. It was amazing. It went on for hours and hours and hours.â€
The majority of those who testified spoke against the bill, she added.
Ingham said that Health Rights MA and Health Action Massachusetts have â€œreally been involved with this from the get-go,â€ referring to the three new bills, by providing the public with information about what the bills would do and issuing action alerts.
West Virginia: â€˜Weâ€™re still moving forwardâ€™
If religious exemptions are taken away in Massachusetts, the state would join a small handful of states that deny parents the right to object to school vaccine requirements on the basis of sincerely held beliefs.
California, New York, Connecticut and Maine allow only medical exemptions, not religious exemptions. However,Â Maine lawmakersÂ are considering bills that would restore religious exemptions.
West Virginia denied religious exemptions until Jan. 14, whenÂ Gov. Patrick Morrisey signed an executive orderÂ allowing religious exemptions.
On March 24, West Virginia lawmakers defeated aÂ billÂ that would have codified Morriseyâ€™s Jan. 14 executive order allowing religious exemptions from mandatory school vaccinations.
The bill died in aÂ 42-56Â vote on the floor of West Virginiaâ€™s House of Delegates after passing the stateâ€™s Senate in aÂ 20-12Â vote in February.
Despite the billâ€™s failure to pass during this yearâ€™s legislative session, West Virginia parents can still apply for a religious exemption under Morriseyâ€™s executive order, said Chanda Adkins, president ofÂ West Virginians for Health Freedom.
The group said it will continue to pressure elected officials during next yearâ€™s legislative session to get religious exemptions officially codified into law. â€œWeâ€™re still moving forward,â€ Adkins told The Defender.
Adkins credited West Virginiaâ€™s progress so far to the many parents and guardians â€” â€œeven the grandparentsâ€ â€” who spoke to their elected officials about how important it is to them to have religious exemptions to vaccine mandates.
West Virginians for Health Freedom has been around since 2016. â€œWe do not plan to abort the mission until there are no mandates,â€ Adkins said.
Hawaii: â€˜The push to erase religious exemptions is still alive and wellâ€™
Meanwhile, the battle to keep religious exemptions continues to brew afterÂ Hawaii lawmakers, under pressure from constituents, voted on March 4 to table a bill that would have repealed the stateâ€™s religious exemption fromÂ vaccineÂ mandates.
Rep. Diamond Garcia, House minority floor leader, who opposed the bill, told The Defender, â€œHB1118 may be dead for now, but make no mistake â€” the push to erase religious exemptions is still alive and well.â€
House Bill 1118Â was part of the â€œgovernorâ€™s package,â€ a set of proposed bills that make up Gov. Josh Greenâ€™sÂ legislative agenda.The bill, introduced in January in the House and Senate, aimed to curb the growing rates ofÂ non-medical exemptionsÂ in the state over the last 10 years.
However, the proposed legislation encountered stiff pushback from the public and grassroots organizations in Hawaii, who responded with letters, public statements and rallies opposing the bill.
Constituents submitted more than 2,000 written statements to state lawmakers opposing the bill and just overÂ 100 supporting it.
Garcia called the bill a â€œdirect assault on people of faith.â€
â€œWeâ€™re not backing down,â€ he said. â€œI will fight any attempt to force families to choose between their convictions and compliance. The government has no business interfering in matters of conscience. We didnâ€™t win the war â€” we won a battle. And weâ€™ll be ready for the next one, because freedom is always worth defending.â€

title: Juxtapose This: Itâ€™s Hard Not To Ask Who Benefits from Rehashing the Hegseth Group Chat Scandal
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
We do a little juxtaposition. Itâ€™s called, we do a little juxtaposition.
â€œJuxtapositionâ€, noun: The act of placing two or more things side by side, often to compare or contrast them. Or, indeed, to suggest they might be connected with each other causally somehow.
When Cornelius Tacitus chose to describe Nero playing his harpâ€”not a fiddleâ€”in his gardens while Rome burned, the great historian was obviously implying Nero was more than just an observer of the conflagration.
After all, what kind of ruler plays a musical instrument and sings about the destruction of ancient Troy while his own capital city, the most magnificent in the known world, is burning to ashes around him?
It would be like, oh, I donâ€™t knowâ€”being California state governor and setting up a website to prove you werenâ€™t responsible for cutting hundreds of millions of dollars from fire services while half of Los Angeles is in flames. That suggests a certain level of self-concern and, dare I say it, guilt, right?
Gavin Newsom actually did that, by the way.
Anyway: juxtaposition. Two things side by side.
Here are two things that happened this week. I just want to place them next to each other for a moment. The implication, obviously, is that they could be connected. But just try to withhold judgment until youâ€™ve read and digested both of them.
And they may not be connected, like Nero may not have been responsible for the Great Fire of Rome, however bizarre his behavior was during it. My two events could just be a coincidenceâ€”one thatâ€™s mighty convenient for certain parties, all the same.
Okay, so hereâ€™s the first. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is in big trouble for his use of the encrypted messaging app Signal. Again.
Over the weekend another story broke, in The New York Times, that Hegseth â€œshared detailed information about forthcoming strikes in Yemen in aÂ private Signal group chatÂ group that included his wife, brother and personal lawyer.â€
Unnamed sources told The Times Hegseth created the group in January, before he was confirmed.
In response to the allegations, the Pentagonâ€™s chief spokesman Sean Parnell said â€œdisgruntled former employeesâ€ were responsible for the claims.
On X, he said the reports â€œrelied only on the words of people who were fired this week and appear to have a motive to sabotageâ€ President Trumpâ€™s wide-ranging agenda at the Pentagon.
â€œThere was no classified information in any Signal chat, no matter how many ways they try to write the story,â€ Parnell added.
â€œWhat is true is that the Office of the Secretary of Defense is continuing to become stronger and more efficient in executing President Trumpâ€™s agenda.â€
The revelations came at the end of a difficult week for the embattled Defense Secretary, as three top officials at the Pentagon were forced out of their jobs. Dan Caldwell, Colin Carroll and Darin Selnick were all fired after being linked by an internal investigation to â€œunauthorized disclosuresâ€ of sensitive information. The three men have protested their innocence.
Former Pentagon spokesman John Ullyot also chose the weekend to launch a blistering personal attack in Politico. The man who just a few months ago described the Defense Secretary as â€œthe best choice to reform the Pentagon,â€ is now hitting him with both barrels for presiding over a â€œfull-blown meltdownâ€ at the worldâ€™s most famous five-sided building. Hegsethâ€™s tenure is becoming a â€œreal problem for the administration,â€ Ullyot saidâ€”the implication being, of course, that he needs to resign.
So thatâ€™s the first thing: fresh trouble for Pete at the Pentagon. Now hereâ€™s the second.
Earlier last week, on Monday, President Trump decided against joint US-Israel military strikes to destroy Iranâ€™s nuclear facilities.
After a tense meeting in the Situation Room, the anti-war party, which argued that a diplomatic solution is not only preferable but still possible, won out. Among the stalwarts of this position were Vice President JD Vance, Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard, special envoy Steve Witkoff andâ€” Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.
President Trump reaffirmed his sensible conviction that Iran must not be allowed to develop nuclear weapons.
â€œPresident Trump has been clear, Iran cannot have a nuclear weapon and all options remain on the table. The President has authorized direct and indirect discussions with Iran to make this point clear, but heâ€™s also made clear this cannot go on indefinitely,â€ White House national security council spokesperson Brian Hughes told Axios.
So: Military strikes could still happen, but for the moment, at least, diplomacy has prevailed. The President has given Iran two months to sign a new nuclear deal. Israel, however, has suggested it may carry out strikes unilaterally.
I think you know what Iâ€™m driving at with this juxtaposition. You already know that war with Iran, leading to regime-change, has been a long-term policy goal of certain bloodthirsty segments of the US establishment for decades. It was the jewel in the crown of the Bush neocon vision for the future of the Middle East, and it remains the treasured dream of lawmakers like Lindsey Graham and Tom Cotton, as well as an entire industry of lobbying groups like the Foundation for the Defense of Democracies. And Israel, too.
Letâ€™s be clear: If Hegseth goesâ€”and there are now a great many loud voices calling for his resignation, Two strikes and youâ€™re outâ€” a significant barrier to joint military action against Iran will have been removed.
Indeed, thereâ€™s a good chance Hegseth will be replaced by an Iran hawk whoâ€™ll actively push for conflict. Back in December, when Hegsethâ€™s personal life was looking like it might derail his confirmation, Mike Waltz was considered as an alternative. Last week, in the Situation Room, it was Waltz arguing for military strikes alongside Marco Rubio.
Like I say, these two events may not actually be connected. Hegsethâ€™s problems at the Pentagon are ongoing, and it may simply be, as Sean Parnell said, that â€œdisgruntled employeesâ€ are responsible for the latest claims against the Defense Secretary, true or not. Hegseth has turned the place upside down already in his quest to restore Americaâ€™s warfighting capability, an enterprise that was bound to make him a lot of enemies even if he didnâ€™t challenge the infinity-war demons as directly as he has.
In truth, it doesnâ€™t really matter if thereâ€™s a connection between these two events. All that matters, at this point, is the outcome: Lose Hegseth and war with Iran, with all its terrible potentials, becomes a much greater possibility. That makes supporting him, and ensuring he stays in the job, all the more urgent for patriots who care about a true America First foreign policy.

title: Russia Formalizes Defense/Economic Treaty With Iran
author: By Sean Miller
content:
On Monday, Moscow formalized a defense and economic cooperation agreement with Tehran, codifying the alliance between the two nations. The â€˜TreatyÂ on the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership between the Islamic Republic of Iran and the Russian Federationâ€˜ includes provisions for the fields of defense, counterterrorism, energy, finance, transport, industry, agriculture, culture, science and technology.
Particularly notable is the fact that the U.S. currently sits opposite of both nations on the global geopolitical stage. Washington has funded Ukraine to attack Russia, had its troops stationed in Ukraine attacking Russia, and threatened Iran with military strikes.
This is not the first instance of Moscow welcoming Tehran with open arms, however. In October Iran attended the 2024 BRICS economic cooperation summit, their first year as a formal member of the bloc.
While this new friendship blossoms in the East, in the West President Donald Trump seeks to carry out two different geopolitical negotiations with the nations.
Regarding Russia, the Trump administration seeks to end the war in Ukraine, an agenda thatÂ the President had made significant progress toward since taking office in January.
With Iran, Trump is seeking the signing of a new nuclear deal which would ensure Tehran does not and will not possess nuclear weapons. This coincides with the Presidentâ€™s global denuclearization agenda, an agenda that the Kremlin has endorsed and signaled a willingness to participate in.
While both White House agendas are currently progressing in positive directions according to officials from either side, the Eastern new alliance being formed will undoubtedly be a consideration to those working the grand chessboard, regardless of their allegiances and agendas.

title: Mayor Proposes Giving Homeless â€œAll The Fentanyl They Wantâ€ to â€œPurgeâ€ Them
author: By Sean Miller
content:
Comments made by Rex Parris, mayor of Lancaster, California back in February have gone viral Friday after he doubled down on his recommendation of administering the deadly opioid fentanyl to his homeless population as part of a â€œpurgeâ€ instead of just concentrating them in a camp, as the city seeks to do. The Mayor clarified that law enforcement has failed to deal with these people while theyâ€™re alive, leading to his recommendation of distributing the often-lethal drug in order to solve the issue once and for all â€“ a final solution to the homeless question.
During the February 25 city council meeting, a resident criticized the cityâ€™s plan of concentrating the homeless in a camp on an abandoned golf course, to which Parris interrupted her, stating that he actually wants to give them endless doses of a drug responsible for tens of thousands of deaths.
â€œNo, what I want to do is give them free fentanyl,â€ he said, to which she asked him to restate himself. â€œI want to give them all the fentanyl they want.â€
On Friday Parris appeared on Fox 11 Los Angeles where he clarified that the purpose of the free fentanyl is to purge the criminal homeless people for the greater good of society.
â€œThey [the homeless] are responsible for most of our robberies, most of our rapes and at least half of our murders,â€ he said Friday. â€œThere is nothing that we can do for these people.â€
There is however one thing the Mayor believes he can do for â€œthe people that want to camp near your home so that they can burglarize them at night, the people that accost you in the store parking lots and intimidate you into giving them money.â€
â€œQuite frankly, I wish the President would give us a purge,â€ Parris said Friday. â€œBecause we do need to purge these people.â€
The Mayor did admit killing off the homeless is â€œharshâ€ however he reaffirmed that the de-facto euthanasia program is necessary due to the lackluster work of law enforcement to manage the homeless while theyâ€™re still alive.
â€œIâ€™m open to any solution,â€ Parris said.
Interestingly Parris has been mayor since 2008. In March 2009 Alex Jones sent Infowars reporters to Los Angeles to document the skyrocketing homeless population which had dramatically increased since the mortgage-backed derivatives crisis and banker bailout.

title: Betting Odds Favor Filipino Cardinal To Replace Pope Francis
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Betting sites have already opened odds on who will be the next pope, with Cardinal Luis Antonion Tagle as the clear early favorite.
Tagle, who hails from the Philippines, is generally seen as a progressive, after expressing his support LGBTQ rights and claiming that universal moral principles may â€œnot apply in all situations.â€
He has, however, been the subject of a certain amount of scandal as a result of alleged â€œshortcomingsâ€ during his time heading the Vatican charity Caritas International.
Current bookmakersâ€™ odds give Tagle a 50% chance of winning the nomination.
Other frontrunners include Pietro Parolin, who currently serves as the Vaticanâ€™s Secretary of State and has advocated greater engagement with the Communist regime in China; French Cardinal Jean-Marc Aveline, who is said to have been Pope Francisâ€™s favoured successor and is generally seen as a leftist; and Cardinal Willem Jacobus Eijk, a Dutch cardinal who holds conservative positions against blessings for same-sex couples, transgenderism and the ordination of female clergy.
Pope Francisâ€™s death was announced early on Monday morning by the Vatican.
â€œAt 7:35 this morning, the Bishop of Rome, Francis, returned to the home of the Father. His entire life was dedicated to the service of the Lord and of his Church,â€Â saidÂ Cardinal Kevin Ferrell, the Vatican camerlengo, in the announcement.
The Pope, who suffered ill health for much of his adult life, spent five weeks in hospital from February into March, as he was treated for double pneumonia.
Latin Americaâ€™s first pontiff and the first Jesuit to hold the office, the Argentinian Pope Francis was elected in 2013 with a mandate to clean house at the Vatican after a damaging series of scandals.
Pope Francis proved to be a progressive leader, pushing the Catholic Church to the left on a variety of issues, including LGBTQ issues, migration and climate change.
In recent weeks, he spoke out against the new Trump administrationâ€™s policies, especially the policy of mass deportations. He urged Catholics â€œnot to give in to narratives that discriminateâ€ against migrants and refugees.
As well as addressing the faithful on Sunday, Pope Francis met Vice President JD Vance, who is himself a Catholic.
The College of Cardinals will now elect a new pope, probably within the next three to four weeks.

title: New Signal Chat Controversy Hits Hegseth
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has been hit with a fresh controversy over his use of the encrypted messaging app Signal.
The New York Times reported on Sunday that Hegseth â€œshared detailed information about forthcoming strikes in Yemen in aÂ private Signal group chatÂ group that included his wife, brother and personal lawyer.â€
Unnamed sources told the Times Hegseth created the group in January, before he was confirmed.
The Pentagonâ€™s chief spokesman Sean Parnell said â€œdisgruntled former employeesâ€ were responsible for the claims.
On X, he said the reports â€œrelied only on the words of people who were fired this week and appear to have a motive to sabotageâ€ President Trumpâ€™s wide-ranging agenda at the Pentagon.
â€œThere was no classified information in any Signal chat, no matter how many ways they try to write the story,â€ Parnell added.
â€œWhat is true is that the Office of the Secretary of Defense is continuing to become stronger and more efficient in executing President Trumpâ€™s agenda.â€
The fresh claims about the Defense Secretaryâ€™s use of the Signal app come at the end of a tumultuous week at the Pentagon.
Three tops officialsâ€”Dan Caldwell, Colin Carroll and Darin Selnickâ€”were all fired after being placed on administrative leave as part of an internal investigation into â€œunauthorized disclosuresâ€ of sensitive information.
â€œAt this time, we still have not been told what exactly we were investigated for, if there is still an active investigation, or if there was even a real investigation of â€˜leaksâ€™ to begin with,â€ the three men said in a jointÂ statementÂ that Caldwell posted on X.
Hegsethâ€™s chief of staff, Joe Kasper, also left his job, for another role at the Defense Department.
Hegseth was also on the receiving end of sharp criticism from John Ullyot, a former Pentagon spokesman who left his job last week.
In an opinion piece published on Sunday by Politico, Ullyot said Â â€œthe last month has been a full-blown meltdown at the Pentagonâ€”and itâ€™s becoming a real problem for the administration.â€
Ullyot also accused Hegsethâ€™s staff of â€œspreading flat-out, easily debunked falsehoods anonymously about their colleagues on their way out the door.â€
Previously, Ullyot called Hegseth â€œthe best choice to reform the Pentagon.â€
Last week it was reported that Hegseth was one of the main players, along with Vice President Vance and Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard, who convinced President Trump against US-Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: Arkansas Protects Religious Adoption Agencies From Placing Children in Same-Sex Homes
author: By Calvin Freiburger | Lifesite
content:
LITTLE ROCK, Arkansas (LifeSiteNews) â€“ Arkansas Republican Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders signed a new law that will ensure religious adoption and foster agencies do not have to place children in same-sex homes or other places that conflict with their faith.
TheÂ Keep Kids First ActÂ forbids the state from â€œrequir(ing) any private child placement agency to perform, assist, counsel, recommend, consent to, refer, or participate in any placement of a child for foster care or adoption when the proposed placement would violate the private child placement agencyâ€™s sincerely held religious or moral beliefsâ€; or from â€œestablish(ing) or enforc(ing) any per se standard, rule, or policy that precludes consideration of a current or prospective foster or preadoptive parent for any particular placement based in whole or in part on the personâ€™s sincerely held religious beliefs regarding sexual orientation or gender identity.â€
It also says the state â€œshall not take any discriminatory action against a person whom the state government places custody of a foster or preadoptive child with, whether in whole or in partâ€ on the basis of that personâ€™s â€œ(s)incerely held religious belief, or intent to guide, instruct, or raise a child, based upon or in a manner that is consistent with that personâ€™s sincerely held religious beliefâ€; or his or her â€œ(r)efusal to accept or support any government policy regarding sexual orientation or gender identity that conflicts with the personâ€™s sincerely held religious beliefs.â€
â€œEvery child deserves a loving home that can provide them stability and opportunities to grow. Yet other states have put politics over people by excluding caring families and faith-based adoption and foster care organizations from helping children find loving homes,â€ Alliance Defending Freedom senior counsel Greg ChafuenÂ responded. â€œThankfully, Arkansas has taken the critical step to pass HB 1669, the Keep Kids First Act, which prioritizes the well-being of kids by prohibiting state and local government officials from discriminating against adoption and foster care providers and parents simply because of their religious beliefs and moral convictions.
â€œADF commends Rep. Mary Bentley and Sen. Alan Clark for their leadership and steadfastness, and Gov. Sanders for signing it into law to ensure more families can open their hearts and homes to children in need of a safe and loving environment. We also thank the Arkansas Family Council for its monumental work on this important effort. Now and always, children deserve loving families.â€
AÂ substantial amount of social science literatureÂ supports the truth that children are best served by homes with both a mother and a father, as each sex tends to bring unique strengths and emphases to parenting, which complement one another; and gives children a positive role model of their own sex as well as helping them to understand and relate to the opposite sex. By contrast, a homosexual male â€œcoupleâ€ would by definition lack a mother, and a lesbian â€œcoupleâ€ would be unable to provide a father.
Yet conservatives and pro-family advocates say that Democratsâ€™ devotion to all aspects of LGBT ideology has come at the cost of a wide array of harms, not only to theÂ physical and mental healthÂ of confused individuals but also to the rights, health, and safety of those who disagree, such asÂ parents denied a sayÂ in their childrenâ€™s upbringing or even knowledge of their trauma, girls and women forced toÂ share intimate facilitiesÂ with males, female athletes forced to compete against biological males with natural physical advantages, and individualsÂ forced to affirmÂ false sexual identities in violation of their consciences, their understanding of scientific fact, and/or their religious beliefs lest they risk firing and/or social ostracization.

title: China Warns Countries Not To Strike Deals with US at Its Expense
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
China has warned other nations not to strike deals with the US that come at its expense, as President Trumpâ€™s trade war with its main competitor continues to escalate.
Chinaâ€™s Commerce Ministry said that while China will respect other countriesâ€™ right to negotiate with the US on an equal footing in response to President Trumpâ€™s â€œreciprocalâ€ tariffs, it will oppose countries that try to benefit at Chinaâ€™s cost.
Beijing â€œwill take countermeasures in a resolute and reciprocal mannerâ€ against such countries, a spokesperson said.
â€œThe United States has abused tariffs on all trading partners under the banner of so-called â€˜equivalence,â€™ while also forcing all parties to start so-called â€˜reciprocal tariffsâ€™ negotiations with them,â€ the spokesperson added.
The announcement comes as the Trump administration readies itself to put pressure on foreign nations looking to reduce US tariffs or even seek exemptions from them, by asking them to reduce their reliance on China.
Dozens of countriesâ€”perhaps as many as 70â€”are said to have approached US representatives to seek new trade deals.
Bilateral talks on tariffs have already taken place with Japan and Indonesia.
After announcing a swathe of â€œreciprocalâ€ tariffs on 2 April, President Trump paused them, except for the tariffs on China, which he increased to 145%.
China has raised tariffs on US goods and also squeezed the supply of rare-earth metals and rare-earth magnets, whose production it monopolises, in a move that will affect the production of vital high-tech goods across the world, including cars and military equipment.
â€œThere are no winners in trade wars and tariff wars,â€ Chinaâ€™s President Xi Jinping said in an article published in Vietnamese media recently.

title: Merz Ally Sparks Establishment Panic After Talking Sense on AfD
author: By Michael Curzon | The European Conservative
content:
Efforts to exclude the right-populist Alternative fÃ¼r Deutschland (AfD) from the German political systemâ€”despite it coming second in the recent federal elections andÂ leading national polls for the first timeÂ earlier this monthâ€”are reportedly crumbling. But establishment figures are scrambling to ensure that this so-called â€˜firewallâ€™ remains in place.
Jens Spahn, an ally of incoming chancellor Friedrich Merz and fellow member of his centre-right CDU, last weekÂ toldÂ BildÂ that politicians must â€œsimply acknowledge â€¦ how many millions of Germans voted for the AfD,â€ in part because they â€œwanted to tell us [establishment types] something.â€ He also â€œrecommend[ed] that
We treat the AfD as an opposition party in the same way in terms of procedures and processes as we would any other opposition party.
Hardly the most extreme of proposals, though the response would suggest otherwise.
Interior Minister Nancy Faeser, who has previously expressed a desire toÂ sackÂ federal police officers who â€œactively supportâ€ the AfD,Â accusedÂ Spahn of being â€œirresponsible and oblivious to historyâ€ because
The AfD is not an opposition party like any other. Anyone who wants to treat it that way and thereby further normalise it is making a serious mistake.
The left-wing SPDâ€™s Matthias Miersch alsoÂ bashedÂ Spahn as â€œfundamentally wrong and very, very dangerous,â€ while the partyâ€™s parliamentary manager, Katja Mast, alsoÂ insistedÂ she would â€œcontinue to protect our democratic institutionsâ€ by blocking the widely democratically-backed AfD.
Clearly unnerved by this backlash, Spahn laterÂ stressedÂ that he â€œdidnâ€™t use the word â€˜normalisationâ€™â€ when discussing the AfD, adding: â€œNobody really needs to tell me what kind of people are sitting in their ranks. I know that.â€
For its part, the AfDÂ declaredÂ on Thursday it is still willing to cooperate with the CDU, praising â€œmore and more leading Christian Democratsâ€ who are â€œcalling for what should actually be a matter of course in a democracy: to finally treat the AfD like any other opposition party.â€ Party officials added that
The exclusion of the AfD harms democracyâ€”it does not strengthen it.
