title: Medicare Wonâ€™t Expand Coverage of Anti-Obesity Drugs
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Medicare wonâ€™t cover anti-obesity drugs like Ozempic and Zepbound for its beneficiaries, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services have announced.
In November 2024, the Biden administration proposed that weight-loss drugs should be covered by Medicare and Medicaid, which would have expanded access to almost 7.5 million Americans.
Older and low-income Americans with a body-mass index of more than 30 would have qualified under the rule. The expanded cover was estimated to cost taxpayers $35 billion over the next decade; although members of Congress on both sides said the cost would save many billions more in healthcare costs associated with obesity.
On Friday, however, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid released a final ruling that coverage would not be extended.
Although weight-loss medications can already be covered by Medicare for conditions like heart disease and diabetes, a 2003 law prevents the program from covering medication that is used directly for weight loss.
Medicare and Medicaid administer health coverage payments for more than 160 million people, spending one in five taxpayer dollars through Medicare, Medicaid, the Childrenâ€™s Health Insurance Program, and the Health Insurance Marketplace.
Robert F. Kennedy Jr., who heads the Department of Health and Human Services, has been a vocal critic of weight-loss medication, suggesting that it does nothing to solve the underlying causes of ill health.
During the election campaign, he said that if â€œevery man, woman and child in our countryâ€ was given â€œgood food, three meals a dayâ€¦ we could solve the obesity and diabetes epidemic overnight.â€
Nevertheless, in December, as he was awaiting confirmation, Secretary Kennedy said drugs like Ozempic â€œhave a placeâ€ in fighting obesity.
More than 200 million Americans are now overweight or obese.
Since 1990, rates have doubled. Around half of all adolescents in the US are overweight or obese, and three-quarters of adults.
Researchers have forecast that by 2050 more than 80% of adults and 60% of adolescents will be overweight or obese if current trends continue.
With 208 million overweight or obese people, the US has one of the highest rates of overweight and obesity worldwide.
Research has shown that obesity accounted for 335,000 deaths in 2021 in the US alone. Obesity is one of the most important and fastest-growing risk factors for chronic disease and early death.
Obesity also has enormous economic implications. A Congressional report published in 2024 predicted that obesity-related health costs will rise to $9.1 trillion over the next decade.

title: Labourâ€™s Muslim Problemâ€”Blindness or Self-Deception?
author: By Frank Haviland | The European Conservative
content:
The Left has a long, storied tradition of staring reality squarely in the face and refusing to believe their lying eyes. And nowhere is this more evident than the Leftâ€™s defence of multiculturalismâ€”a project so disastrous that even its architects have admitted it to be dead. Yet here we are, in 2025, watching senior Labour politicians prancing around the corpse of cultural diversity, insisting itâ€™s still got a pulse.
While the fabled benefits of multiculturalism are yet to materialise, its ill effects are now undeniable. In Britain, despite an impressive majority of 174 seats in last yearâ€™s general election, the Labour Partyâ€™s diversity chickens have finally come home to roost. First we were treated to the shameful spectacle ofÂ Angela Rayner, begging male Muslim voters (naturally, there were no women in sight) not to oust her from her Ashton-under-Lyne seat; promising that if Labour got into power it would â€˜recognise Palestine.â€™ The clip is a painful, but necessary watchâ€”more reminiscent of a hostage video than a party political broadcast:
Next up was theÂ soi-disantÂ feminist firebird of Birmingham Yardley, Jess Phillips. Last July, Phillips clung to her seat by a wafer-thin 693 votesâ€”hardly a mandate to write home about. During her victory speech she was heckled by a mob of pro-Palestine activists, notably predominantly Muslim men, who chanted â€œFree Palestineâ€ and â€œShame on you.â€ When asked about the abuse, however, Phillips pooh-poohed the suggestion that the abuse was sectarian, as â€œtoo simpleâ€ an explanation:
People want desperately for me to announce that the people shouting at me and barracking me were Muslim men.
The fact that they were men is quite significant to meâ€”the fact that they were Muslim is not significant because there are Muslim people in my constituency who didnâ€™t behave like this.
These people were idiots. They didnâ€™t do it because they were Muslimâ€”they did it because they were idiots, and they wanted something for themselves, and they used a terrible tragedy to get that.
There you have itâ€”no reason not to berate â€˜the patriarchy,â€™ but the Muslim element had absolutely nothing to do with it. The fact that her constituency is almostÂ 43% MuslimÂ clearly doesnâ€™t faze Jess, especially when being â€˜pro-Gazaâ€™ apparently gets youÂ better treatment on the NHS.
Last week, it was the turn of former Leicester South MP, Johnathan Ashworth, who was tipped for a cushy cabinet post under Keir Starmer before shockingly losing his seat to relative unknown Shockat Adam, a pro-Gaza independent who rode a wave of Muslim votes to victory. Interviewed inÂ The Telegraph,Â Mr Ashworth claimed that multiculturalism hasnâ€™t failed, and rejected the notion that the loss of his seat ought to give him pause for thought:
In my case, in my seat, there was a huge, huge, huge strength of feeling about the issue of Gaza, which I understand. People felt that somehow, if I had voted for an SNP rebel amendment, that would have delivered a ceasefire.
Of course it wouldnâ€™t, and the campaigners who said so were obviously being dishonest. But thatâ€™s the rough and tumble of politics. I donâ€™t think itâ€™s a failure of multiculturalism, not at all.
â€˜The rough and tumble of politicsâ€™ John-boy?! You were chased out of your own patch by a baying mob screaming â€œGenocide Johnâ€, and were forced toÂ take refuge in the local vicarage!
Hereâ€™s what Ashworth said at the time, although of course (like Phillips) he failed to make the multicultural connection to the extremism:
I have never known a campaign of such vitriol, such bullying, such intimidation built on the foul and obnoxious lie that I was responsible for genocide. That I had the blood of Gazan children on my hands.
This is the campaign that was run by a minority of bullies, and loud mouths. This is not representative of the many, many Muslim constituents I was proud to represent. This is not Muslim values.
Hereâ€™s the rub: dataÂ  screams that heâ€™s wrong. According toÂ a 2024 pollÂ commissioned by the Henry Jackson Society, 46% of UK Muslims support Hamas, and the majority does not believe the terrorist group committed murder and rape on October 7. Also 46% of Muslim respondents said they believe that Jews have too much influence, in comparison to 16% of the general public.
Itâ€™s hardly a shock thatÂ White Brits are now minoritiesÂ in the nationâ€™s largest cities, but if the multicultural hymn sheet had any validity this wouldnâ€™t matter, thanks to the high levels of integration observed by Britainâ€™s latest influx. The promised integration is a myth however: almostÂ a million migrantsÂ can barely speak English.
Even the former chairman of the Equality and Human Rights Commission,Â Trevor Phillips, admitted a decade ago that Muslim integration is not going to happen: â€œContinuously pretending that a group is somehow eventually going to become like the rest of us is perhaps the deepest form of disrespect.â€
â€˜Diversity is our strengthâ€™ is now a busted flush, and even its most die-hard advocates look a little embarrassed when parroting the line.
Which begs the question, what precisely are Ashworth and his ilk playing at? Are the Left genuinely so deluded they cannot see the reality in front of them, or is this myopia a mere cynical ploy to cling to office if not to power? Special cases aside, I generally credit the opposition with more intelligence than they choose to advertise in their shop windowâ€”and weâ€™d better hope thatâ€™s the caseâ€”because if Starmer et al are truly as blind as they seem to be, then Britain on its current trajectory is finished.
The likely (and egregious) explanation is that Ashworth and co. know the score full well, and are simply too wedded to the votes mass immigration generates to come clean. In his interview withÂ The Telegraph, Ashworth simultaneously claimed multiculturalism in Britain is not failing, and at the same time (no longer an MP) clearly felt confident enough to reveal that he has urged the Prime Minister to consider immigration caps for certain sectors of the economy, in order to curb numbers.
Unimpressed by the likes ofÂ Angela Merkel,Â David CameronÂ andÂ Nicholas Sarkozy, all of whom admitted 15 years ago that multiculturalism was an abject failure, Starmerâ€™s government may dodge the post-mortem for now. Rayner can beg for votes all she likes, Phillips can blame â€˜idiotsâ€™ rather than Muslims, and Ashworth may feel secure heading up the Labour Together think tank, but the reality of multiculturalism will catch up with them one way or another. Most likely they will only lose their seats, unlike the rest of us who are losing our country.

title: US First: Idaho Legalizes Firing Squads for Pedophiles
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Courts in Idaho will be able to impose the death penalty on individuals convicted of aggravated lewd conduct with minors aged 12 or younger, with firing squad as the main method of execution.
Governor Brad Little signed into law a bill that will create a new criminal charge punishable by execution.
To seek the death penalty, prosecutors must show at least three of 17 specific aggravating factors. These include multiple incidents of abuse, the use of force, and the transmission of a sexually transmitted disease to the victim.
In cases that do not qualify for the death penalty but involve children up to the age of 16, mandatory prison sentences will apply.
Governor Little said the highest possible punishment should be reserved for those who sexually abuse children.
â€œJust like capital murder destroys lives, aggravated sexual abuse of a young child devastates victims and families for generations,â€ the Governor said.
State politicians have praised the legislation, saying existing laws were too weak.
According to State Representative Bruce Skaug, the new law â€œestablishes a strong deterrent, making it clear Idaho will not tolerate these offenses.â€
â€œIdaho currently has some of the most lenient statutes for child molestation and child rape in the nation.â€
The new law will go into effect on 1 July.

title: Bessent: 50+ Countries Want To Lower Tariffs
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
â€œMore than 50 countriesâ€ have now approached the Trump administration to make deals to lower tariffs and reduce trade barriers, according to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, after President Trumpâ€™s announcement of â€œreciprocal tariffsâ€ on Wednesday sent shockwaves across the world.
â€œMore than 50 countries have approached â€¦ the administration about lowering their non-tariff trade barriers, lowering their tariffs, stopping currency manipulation,â€ Bessent told NBCâ€™s Kristen Welker on Sunday.
â€œAndâ€¦ theyâ€™ve been bad actors for a long time. And itâ€™s not the kind of thing you can negotiate away, be it in days or weeks.â€
Trumpâ€™s announcement of the tariffs on Wednesdayâ€”which he called â€œLiberation Dayâ€â€”caused panic at home and abroad, and a record two-day decline in stock-market value of $5 trillion. Prices for oil and commodities plummeted, as investors sought a measure of safety in government bonds.
The 10% baseline tariff took effect at 12.01 am ET on Saturday. At 12.01am ET on Wednesday, Trumpâ€™s higher â€œreciprocalâ€ tariff rates, varying from 11% to 50%, will also take effect. Imports from the European Union will face a 20% tariff, while Chinese goods will be subject to an additional 34% tariff, bringing the total Trump has imposed on China to 54%.
In his interview, the Treasury Secretary described the tariffs as a â€œone-time price adjustment.â€
â€œHave you expressed any concerns to President Trump directly that his tariff policy could be inflationary?â€ Welker asked Bessent.
â€œNo, what I have said is tariffs are a one-time price adjustment,â€ Bessent responded.
â€œSo, thereâ€™s a big difference between insipid, endemic inflation within the system and consistent price-level increases and a one-time adjustment.â€
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent obliterates NBC's Kristen Welker on tariffs with numbers:"Kristen, what I like is dataâ€¦A 20% tariff on China led to a 0.7% price level increase over 4 years. I think that's pretty goodâ€¦The little-publicized story this week: everyone wants toâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/uNlaIll4Pw
President Trump has stressed that his tariffs will cause an â€œeconomic revolution.â€
â€œWe have been the dumb and helpless â€˜whipping post,â€™ but not any longer,â€ the PresidentÂ wrote on Truth Social, on Saturday.
â€œWe are bringing back jobs and businesses like never before. Already, more than FIVE TRILLION DOLLARS OF INVESTMENT, and rising fast!â€
â€œTHIS IS AN ECONOMIC REVOLUTION, AND WE WILL WIN,â€ he added. â€œHANG TOUGH, it wonâ€™t be easy, but the end result will be historic. We will, MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!!!â€

title: Obama Lashes Out at Trump

content:
Former US President Barack Obama has said that he isÂ â€œdeeply concernedâ€Â by the policies that the countryâ€™s current leader, Donald Trump, has pursued since the start of his second term in office.
During his speech at Hamilton College in New York State on Thursday, Obama criticized the Trump administrationâ€™s protectionist economic policies, attempts to tackle federal spending, clampdown on immigration, and treatment of the media.
He denounced the sweeping tariffs imposed by Trump earlier this week on the majority of US trading partners, saying:Â â€œI do not think what we just witnessedâ€¦ is going to be good for America.â€
However, the 63-year-old Democrat stressed that the tariffs are just one policy, and that he isÂ â€œmore deeply concerned with a federal government that threatens universities if they donâ€™t give up students who are exercising their right to free speech,â€Â referring to actions taken against pro-Palestinian demonstrators.
The Trump administrationâ€™s pressure on law firms and its decision to bar AP journalists from accessing the Oval Office reflectÂ â€œa kind of behavior [that] is contrary to the basic compact we have as Americans,â€Â the former president said.
â€œImagine if I had pulled Fox Newsâ€™ credentials from the White House press corps. It is unimaginable that the same parties that are silent now would have tolerated behavior like that from me or a whole bunch of my predecessors,â€Â he argued.
The former president concluded his message by saying thatÂ â€œhistory zigs and zags and there are times of conflict and there are times of stupidity and there are times of danger.â€
Trump slammed Obama at the height of the race for the White House last year, calling the former presidentÂ â€œa jerkâ€Â and saying that heÂ â€œdivides this countryâ€Â by campaigning for then-Democratic contender Kamala Harris.

title: HANDS OFF! Protesters Gather for Rallies Organized by Soros-backed Activist Group

title: Boasberg May Hold Trump Officials in Contempt over Deportation Flights
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
The Obama-appointed judge who blocked President Trumpâ€™s use of the Alien Enemies Act to deport Venezuelan gang members, is considering holding officials in contempt of court for their role in allowing deportation flights to take place.
Judge James Boasberg said the administration acted in â€œbad faithâ€ on 15 March when it sent three deportation flights loaded with hundreds of suspected gang members, at the same time as Boasberg was preparing an emergency court hearing on the legality of the flights.
At a hearing on Thursday, during which he grilled members of the Department of Justice, Boasberg said he is considering holding officials in contempt of court.
According to Politico, Boasberg could impose fines or jail time, and he could even attempt to order El Salvador, where hundreds of the deportees were taken, to return them.
Boasberg has not yet said who in particular he believes was in contempt of court.
It is unusual, but not unprecedented, for executive-branch officials to be held in contempt of court. In Trumpâ€™s first term, Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos was held in contempt and fined $100,000 for violating a court order.
Judge Boasberg also drew attention to the case of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who some are claiming was wrongly deported to El Salvador as a suspected MS-13 member.
â€œLo and behold, at least one that we know of shouldnâ€™t have been there in the first place,â€ Boasberg said.
The day after Boasbergâ€™s hearing, another Obama judge ordered Garcia man to be returned to the US by Monday at midnight.
â€œThis was an illegal act,â€ Judge Paula Xinis told a Justice Department lawyer, according toÂ Politico.
â€œCongress said you canâ€™t do it, and you did it anyway.â€
According to the White House, the man in question, Kilmar Abrego Garcia, was a member of the criminal gang MS-13, which has now been designated a terrorist organization. He is said to have been involved in human trafficking. He was apprehended in Maryland last month, before being flown to El Salvador, where he now resides in President Nayib Bukeleâ€™s fearsome CECOT prison.
Judge Xinis, however, said that the accusation of gang membership is â€œjust chatter.â€
â€œIn a court of law, when someone is accused of membership in such a violent and predatory organization, it comes in the form of an indictment, a complaint, a criminal proceeding that has robust process so we can assess the facts,â€ Xinis added.
In response to Judge Xinisâ€™s decision, the White House, via Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt, issued a defiant statement.
â€œWe suggest the Judge contact President Nayib Bukele because we are unaware of the judge having jurisdiction or authority over the country of El Salvador.â€
Rumours that Garcia was not a gang member have been circulating for at least a week. On Tuesday, Leavitt shut down these rumours during a press conference, stating unequivocally that the Trump administration knows Garcia was a member of MS-13 and that he was involved in human trafficking.
â€œThe administration maintains the position that this individual was deported to El Salvador and will not be returning to our country and was a member of the brutal and vicious MS-13 gang.â€

title: WATCH: Nancy Pelosi Demands Reciprocal Tariffs on China in 1996 House Speech
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Footage has resurfaced on social media of Nancy Pelosi demanding reciprocal tariffs against China to rebalance the US trade deficit with China.
Pelosi has been a staunch critic of President Trumpâ€™s new wave of tariffs, which were unveiled on Wednesday.
In response to the wide-ranging duties, Pelosi said, â€œDonald Trumpâ€™s reckless tariffs will cause chaos in our economy, raise prices for consumers and hurt hardworking American families.â€
â€œThis is not a strategyâ€”itâ€™s the largest tax hike on the American people in history,â€ she added.
But back in 1996, a much fresher-faced Pelosi was singing a different tune.
Incredible clip from 1996. Nancy Pelosi on tariffs and the trade deficit with China."On this day, your member of Congress could have drawn the line to say to the President of the United States, do something about this US-China trade relationship that is a job loser for theâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/DFlQ9wWSKh
â€œHow far does China have to go?â€ Pelosi asked.
â€œHow much more repression, how big a trade deficit and loss of jobs for the American worker, and how much more dangerous proliferation has to exist before members of this House of Representatives will say, â€˜I will not endorse the status quo.â€™ As I mentioned, itâ€™s about jobs, proliferation, and human rights. And there are those who say we shouldnâ€™t link human rights and trade and proliferation and trade; I disagree. But if we just want to take up this issue on the basis of economics alone, Indeed, China should not receive most favored nation status for several reasons that Iâ€™d like to go into now.â€
Pelosi then produced a chart not unlike President Trumpâ€™s to demonstrate the trade deficit, which at that time stood at $34 billion.
The Democrat Congresswoman from California went on to question the disparity between American (2%) and Chinese (35%) tariffs, asking â€œIs that reciprocal?â€
She described the effects of this economic imbalance on American jobs as â€œthe biggest and cruelest hoax of all.â€
â€œNot only do we not have market access, not only do they have prohibitive tariffs, not only are our exports not let in very specifically, but China benefits with at least, at least 10 million jobs from US China trade.â€
What a difference a few decades can make.

title: Colorado House Approves Bill That Could Allow State To Seize Children from Parents if They Misgender Them
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Parents could have their children taken from them if they â€œmisgenderâ€ them, under the terms of a bill that was just approved in Coloradoâ€™s Democrat-controlled State House.
On Friday, the Colorado State House passed bill HB25-1312, â€œLegal Protections for Transgender Individuals,â€ which makes â€œmisgenderingâ€ any individual, including a child, a discriminatory action. The legislation also permits the state to take children from their parents if theyâ€™re guilty of â€œmisgendering.â€
The bill also protects parents from prosecution for seeking â€œgender-affirming careâ€ for their children.
The billâ€™s sponsor, Rep. Rebekah Stewart, argued the legislation would actually protect children.
â€œSupporting a childâ€™s gender identity is indeed in the best interest of the child, and that support cannot be used against a loving and supportive parent in a dispute,â€ she said.
â€œThis bill is truly the least that we can do. Frankly, I wish that we didnâ€™t have to bring this bill, but the reality of navigating the world today as a transgender human necessitates it.â€
Colorado Republicans slammed the bill.
â€œThe idea that misgendering your own child is considered coercive control, which is another word for child abuse, because you want to get your child help instead of affirming their delusionsâ€¦ this is the most disgusting bill Iâ€™ve seen so far,â€Â saidÂ GOP State Rep. Jarvis Caldwell, from Colorado Springs.
Bill HB25-1312 now passes to the State Senate, which is also controlled by the Democrats, and from there to Democrat Governor Jared Polis.

title: Trump Popularity Increases with Tariffs
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
President Donald Trumpâ€™s approval rating has increased since he unleashed a wave of new tariffs on Americaâ€™s trading partners.
According to new polling from The Daily Mail, Trumpâ€™s approval rating has risen to 53%, an increase of 4%, between 31 March and 3 April.
As The Mail notes, Trumpâ€™s rising approval rating is surprising given the flak theÂ White HouseÂ has received over the tariff order signed Wednesday.â€
Support among 18-29 year olds is up a whopping 13% since 7 March, and 17% among black voters since last week.
Trump has also seen a 6% increase among Democrats and independents.
With regard to his tariff policy in particular, the polling suggests more Americans support than oppose it. The same was also true for his policy of increasing tariffs.
Voters also broadly support tariffs that touch specific sectors like aviation, plastics, precious metals, and iron and steel.
The 10% baseline tariff took effect at 12.01 am ET on Saturday and represents â€œthe single biggest trade action of our lifetime,â€ according to former White House trade adviser Kelly Ann Shaw.
Among the countries subject to the 10% tariff are Australia, Britain, Colombia, Argentina, Egypt and Saudi Arabia.
At 12.01am ET on Wednesday, Trumpâ€™s higher â€œreciprocalâ€ tariff rates, varying from 11% to 50%, will take effect. Imports from the European Union will face a 20% tariff, while Chinese goods will be subject to an additional 34% tariff, bringing the total Trump has imposed on China to 54%.
Canada and Mexico are exempt from Trumpâ€™s latest duties because they remain subject to an earlier 25% tariff related to the fentanyl and illegal immigration crises. Trump is also excluding goods subject to separate 25% national-security tariffs, which include steel and aluminum, cars, trucks and auto parts.
The new tariffs are expected to force foreign countries to the negotiating table. Vietnam, which was hit with one of the highest tariff ratesâ€”46%â€”has already agreed to discuss new trade terms with Trump.
Trumpâ€™s announcement of the tariffs on Wednesday sent out a global shockwave, causing a record two-day decline in stock-market value of $5 trillion. Prices for oil and commodities plummeted, as investors sought a measure of safety in government bonds.

title: Watch: Stephen Colbert Pleads with Deep State to Stop Trump

content:
CBS Late Show host Stephen Colbert called on the Deep State to thwart President Donald Trump after he unveiled reciprocal tariffs this week aimed at stopping other nations from ripping off the US.
In a rant criticizing the tariffs, the leftist teleprompter reader delusionally joked there was a glimmer of hope in the situation as it proved the â€œDeep Stateâ€ is fictional, otherwise they would have stopped Trump by now.
WATCHğŸ˜³: Stephen Colbert kicked off his Late Show monologue on Thursday by staring into the camera and pleading with â€œthe cabal of financial and governmental elites who pull all the strings behind the scenesâ€ to intervene as President Donald Trump announced reciprocal tariffs.â€¦ pic.twitter.com/sy3uGuscEi
Now one, one, one, one bit of good news coming out all this â€” itâ€™s, itâ€™s all pretty solid proof that there is no Deep State. Cuz if there was, they would have stopped this.
Okay. But if they do exist, I just want to say to the cabal of financial and governmental elites who pull all the strings behind the scenes: maybe put a pause on your 5G chip, JFK Jr, adrenochrome, chemtrail orgy, and jump in here.
Cuz weâ€™re dying.
The desperate globalist lap dogâ€™s late night meltdown came as Trump on Wednesday introduced sweeping reciprocal tariffs forcing nations to pay higher prices to import their goods to the US or come to the bargaining table.

With the stolen election, the censorship and de-platforming, the unending lawfare, the raid on Mar-a-Lago, the multiple bungled assassination attempts, and the obstruction of his agenda, hasnâ€™t the Deep State done enough, or at least by this point proven their ineptitude?

title: Munich Revisited: Why JD Vance Was Right about Europeâ€™s Leaders, Two Months on
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
JD Vance was right. So right.
Back in February, the Vice President travelled to Munich, Germany, with a message for Europeâ€™s entire political elite. It was a message they didnâ€™t want to hear, but the VP was determined to deliver it anyway.
â€œThe threat I worry most about vis-a-vis Europe is not Russia,â€ Vance told a stunned, deathly silent auditorium.
â€œItâ€™s not China. Itâ€™s not any external actor. What I worry about is the threat from within, the retreat of Europe from some of its most fundamental values.â€
This was actually a polite way of telling Europeâ€™s elite they are traitors to their nations and people; that they are destroying what it is their sacred duty to protect.
The message was received.
The only people clapping were members of the Vice Presidentâ€™s entourage. At least one European politicianâ€”and a man, at thatâ€”actually burst into tears afterwards, so great was his shock about being confronted with the truth. Ursula Von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, looked like sheâ€™d taken a silver stake to her shrivelled little heart.
Europeâ€™s politicians and media united to portray the speech as a declaration of war against Europe, as a betrayal in its own right. The nation that once saved Europe has now turned its back. Allies no more.
But Vanceâ€™s speech was nothing of the sort. In fact, it was a speech of unity, not division. Hereâ€™s what he was saying. The American and European people have suffered under the same yokeâ€”the yoke of globalism, of open borders at all costs, of rootless cosmopolitanism and the desire for endless growthâ€”but now the American people are throwing it off. If the European people want Americaâ€™s help to do the same, it will be forthcoming. But America will not help Europeâ€™s elites to continue burying the ideals and the people that made European civilization the greatest the world has ever seen.
The real question the Vice President was posing at Munich was whether Europeâ€™s elite would get behind their people and support them in their bid for freedom, or instead be forced to get out of the way.
Eight weeks later, it already looks like theyâ€™ve made their choice.
In just the last week, in France weâ€™ve seen presidential frontrunner Marine LePen barred from running in the 2027 election through a very convenient judicial decision. For the supposed crime of embezzling EU funds, a judge decided LePen would be unable to stand for political office for five years. Sheâ€™s also been sentenced to four years in prison and a 100,000 euro fine. Sheâ€™s unlikely ever to see the inside of a jail cellâ€”half of the sentence will probably be served under some form of house arrest with an electronic tag, the other half will be suspendedâ€”but thatâ€™s cold comfort for LePen, whose presidential ambitions, cultivated for decades, have effectively been dashed.
The ruling doesnâ€™t prevent LePenâ€™s charismatic and handsome deputy Bardella from running in her stead, but make no mistake, this is a deliberate and devastating strike at the French right, which is rising on the back of widespread anger at the effects of mass immigration and other globalist policies. LePen is most responsible for â€œmodernisingâ€ the party and making it electorally successful. She has shaped the party, remaking it in her own image rather than her fatherâ€™s, and in doing so brought it to the cusp of power. Thereâ€™s no way this ruling doesnâ€™t seriously damage the partyâ€™s chances at the ballot box in two yearsâ€™ time. LePen can of course appeal, but itâ€™s unlikely sheâ€™ll be heard before the election.
A fait accompli, thatâ€™s called.
The verdict has been attacked by President Trump and Elon Musk. Musk wrote on Twitter, â€œWhen the radical left canâ€™t win via democratic vote, they abuse the legal system to jail their opponents.â€
Hereâ€™s Italyâ€™s Matteo Salvini, another populist leader, again on Twitter: â€œThis is a declaration of war by Brussels. We will not be intimidated, we will not stop.â€
LePen now joins a growing list of European politicians, including Salvini and also Romaniaâ€™s Georgescu, who have been attacked through the courts by their globalist enemies, just like Donald Trump was.
And if the lawfare fails, the case of Trumpâ€™s long persecution shows us what might happen next. I mean assassination. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™m being dramatic. If it happened twice in America in a single presidential campaign, it can certainly happen in Europe. The stakes are just as high, and the enemies of national revival there are just as determined.
Itâ€™s also possible that weâ€™ll see parties like the Alternative for Germany (AfD) outlawed. The leader of Germanyâ€™s intelligence service and members of the Bundestag have already suggested doing soâ€”â€œto save democracy.â€
To save democracy, it seems, America and Europe really are now on divergent paths, with totally different understandings of what that means. As Trumpâ€™s tariff war, just begun, escalates, the distance across the Atlantic will only widen, and negotiations over the end of the Russia-Ukraine war also threaten to do the same. My only hope is that the gap will not prove so wide it cannot be crossed when the time is right for Europe, finally, to seek its freedom.

title: BREAKING: Chaos in DC as Radical Anti-American Factions Launch Protests Against Trump Admin

content:
Radical groups from all corners of the anti-American left descended on Washington D.C. to protest against the Trump administration on Sunday.
Border Hawk is on the ground documenting unrest in the nationâ€™s capital as pre-planned â€œHands Offâ€ demonstrations unfold across the U.S.
Thousands of activists were reportedly bused in to the D.C. area from around the country this week.
Multiple groups are descending on Washington D.C. for anti-Trump, anti-DOGE, and pro-Palestine protests Thousands bused in from all over the country According to organizers, childrenâ€™s are lined in the main road signifying the children who have died in GAZA Free Luigi signsâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/0cGpp4S7XA
Another massive group has gathered near the Monument to rally against President Trump, DOGE, Musk, and almost any other issue BLM, Trans rights, schools, USAID etc pic.twitter.com/b3y7QWOelT
One sign being waved at an anti-Trump, anti-Musk gathering read, â€œSomebody just do it already,â€ leaving little to the imagination.
A protester at the anti-Trump/anti-Musk rally holds a sign reading, â€œSomebody just do it already.â€ pic.twitter.com/LP0WjCg3YX
Sikh separatists also marched, many of whom were carrying flags of Khalistan.
The Sikh Freedom March joins the demonstrations in Washington D.C. today pic.twitter.com/JvnJUnvgH7

Worlds Collide: The Pro-Palestine group encounters the Sikh contingent pic.twitter.com/Uzz8o012UO

title: Video: Reporter Questions Mayorkas on Biden Border Failures â€” He Awkwardly Refuses to Respond
author: By Adan Salazar
content:
Former DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas refused to take questions from a reporter asking if he regretted failures at the southern border that ultimately made the American people vote for Donald Trump.
Spotting Mayorkas at the Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport, The Blaze correspondent Julio Rosas got to work holding the ex-Biden officialâ€™s feet to the fire.
â€œI just wanted to ask you how it feels to see that the United States has a secure border now that President Trump is in office, as opposed to when you were Secretary of Homeland Security?â€ Rosas quizzed Mayorkas, adding that illegal crossings have plunged by 95%.
CLOSED BORDER: Disgraced former DHS Secretary Mayorkas is asked why he didnâ€™t close the border like Trump has? Congress needs to have him come answer these questions under oath.  pic.twitter.com/AuhE1WDuHE
After briefly greeting the reporter, Mayorkas proceeded to ignore him and pretend he wasnâ€™t there, staring off bizarrely into the distance as Rosas asked, â€œDo you have any regret facilitating an open border, sir?â€
â€œDo you regret allowing Tren de Argua to gain a foothold in the United States, sir?â€ the reporter continued, mentioning the Venezuelan gang terrorizing American communities in recent years.
â€œDo you have anything to say, sir, about your time as Homeland Security Secretary, facilitating an open border? I mean it was a big issue, sir. Itâ€™s one of the reasons why President Trump won re-election. You donâ€™t have anything to say about it?â€ the reporter again attempted to no avail.
â€œDo you have regret about losing trackâ€¦of all those thousands of migrant children who are handed over to HHS?â€
Clearly, the cowardly ex-DHS Sec. is ashamed of his tenure and inaction, as the Trump admin continues fulfilling promise after promise to the American people â€” including closing the porous border endangering the country.

title: Supreme Court Shuts Down Activist Judge, Lets Trump Cut $250 Million in DEI Training for Teachers
author: By Zero Hedge
content:
The Supreme Court on FridayÂ overruled an activist judge in Boston,Â allowing the Trump administration to slash $250 million for more than 100 teacher training grants for DEI and other woke programs.
In a 5-4 decisionÂ nine days after the request, the Supremes sided with the Trump administrationâ€™s emergency request to stay the court order by judge Myong J. Joun of the federal District of Massachusetts â€“ who had ordered the Trump administration to â€œimmediately restoreâ€ the â€œpre-existing status quo prior to the termination.â€
According to the ruling â€“Â which is likely to narrow the ability of district courts to halt agency actions involving grant function,Â Joun lacked authorityÂ to order the Trump admin to restore the funding.
In his ruling, Myong sided with California and eight other blue states that argued that the cuts were likely driven by efforts by the Trump administration to gut DEI programs (duh).
Meet the federal Judge who just blocked President Trumpâ€™s cuts to DEI teacher training.His resume is full of DEI activism, he served on the board of groups currently suing President Trump, and trained far-left activists how to avoid arrests during protests.ğŸ§µğŸ§µğŸ§µ pic.twitter.com/KSp77nbT2X
The cuts were announced on Feb. 17,Â following findings by DOGE that taxpayer funds were being used to â€œtrain teachers and education agencies on divisive ideologiesâ€ that were â€œinappropriate and unnecessary,â€ including â€œcritical race theory,; diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI); social justice activism; â€˜anti-racismâ€™; and instruction on white privilege and white supremacy.â€
And of course, dissenting in the Supreme Court decision wereÂ Justices Jackson, Sotomayor, Kagan, andÂ Chief Justice Roberts.

title: â€˜Free Le Penâ€™ â€“ Trump to France
author: By RT
content:
US President Donald Trump has accused the French political establishment of employing lawfare against right-wing figure Marine Le Pen, urging Paris toÂ â€œfreeâ€Â her.
On Monday, a Paris courtÂ sentencedÂ Le Pen to four years in prison and imposed a five-year ban on her eligibility for public office, effectively preventing her from running in the 2027 presidential election.
In a post on Truth Social late Thursday, Trump declared Le Pen a victim of aÂ â€œwitch hunt.â€Â He asserted that the prosecution of Le Pen was orchestrated byÂ â€œEuropean Leftists using Lawfare to silence Free Speech, and censor their Political Opponent.â€
â€œIt is the same â€˜playbookâ€™ that was used against me by a group of Lunatics and Losers, like Norm Eisen, Andrew Weissmann, and Lisa Monaco,â€Â he remarked, referring to attorneys who were involved in litigation against him since his first term as president. Trump claims those proceedings were politically-driven.
Although Trump admitted he did not personally know Le Pen or the specifics of her case, which he assumed stemmed from aÂ â€œbookkeepingâ€Â error, he expressed admiration for her resilience. He concluded,Â â€œIt is all so bad for France, and the Great French People, no matter what side they are on. FREE MARINE LE PEN!â€
Le Pen and several other senior members of her National Rally (RN) party were found guilty of misappropriating EU funds intended to support European Parliament members for domestic party activities. The offenses occurred between 2004 and 2016, when she was the leader of RN.
Several foreign political leaders criticized the ruling as a blow to democracy in France. Trump previouslyÂ describedÂ it asÂ â€œa very big deal.â€Â Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni contended that the sentenceÂ â€œtakes away representation from millions of citizens,â€Â while her Hungarian counterpart, Viktor Orban, expressed his solidarity with Le Pen by postingÂ â€œJe suis Marine!â€
Le Pen characterized the ruling asÂ â€œpolitical,â€Â asserting that it reflected aÂ â€œlower court judgeâ€Â depriving French voters of the opportunity to back their preferred presidential candidate.

title: Border Apprehensions Continue To Fall from Record Low
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Apprehensions at the southern border with Mexico have continued to fall, after reaching a record low in February, down 95% on the same month in 2024.
Customs and Border Protection officials reported that border encounters fell from 8,327 in February to 7,180 in March, a further 13% decrease.
â€œThe month of March recorded the lowest southwest border crossings in history, marking a pivotal achievement in our nationâ€™s border security efforts,â€ CBP said in an official statement.
â€œThis milestone demonstrates that operational control is becoming a realityâ€”which seemed impossible just a few months ago under the Biden administrationâ€”as enforcement measures continue to yield significant results.â€
Acting Commissioner Pete Flores hailed the figures and warned migrants thinking of attempting to cross the border not to come.
â€œUnder the leadership of President Trump and Secretary Noem, the administration has taken bold, decisive action to restore control at the border. Border Patrol agents are empowered like never before to shut down unlawful entry and protect American lives,â€ Flores said.
â€œThe message is clear: the border is closed to illegal crossings, and for those still willing to test our resolve, know thisâ€”you will be prosecuted, and you will be deported.â€
The figures for March 2025 are a stunning contrast with those for March 2024. Whereas 7,180 border encounters were recorded in March 2025, the figure was 137, 743 in March 2024.
The effects of President Trumpâ€™s border policies were immediate. After signing ten executive orders touching immigration on his first day in office, encounters at the southern border nearly halved during his first full month in office.
The Trump administration is continuing to ramp up efforts to deport millions of illegal aliens in the country, including reassigning large numbers of federal workers at agencies like the ATF to work on immigration.
At the end of last month, Reuters reported, â€œAs U.S. President Donald Trump pledges to deport â€˜millions and millionsâ€™ of â€˜criminal aliens,â€™ thousands of federal law enforcement officials from multiple agencies are being enlisted to take on new work as immigration enforcers.â€
â€œI do not recall ever seeing this wide a spectrum of federal government resources all being turned toward immigration enforcement,â€ said Theresa Cardinal Brown, a former Homeland Security official who spoke with Reuters.
Although the specific number of federal workers being redirected to immigration is not fully clear, Reuters notes that the effort is reminiscent of the â€œaftermath of the 2001 attacks, when Congress created the Department of Homeland Security that pulled together 169,000 federal employees from other agencies and refocused the FBI on battling terrorism.â€
According to one ATF official, around 80% of the organizationâ€™s 2,500 agents have been ordered to take on immigration-related tasks. At least a quarter of DEA agents are also working on immigration.
So far, Trumpâ€™s mass-deportation program has made notable gains, while also facing challenges.
Although the number of migrants crossing the southern border is now at a record low and many of the most dangerous criminals have been apprehended and deported, securing adequate funding has proven an early difficulty.
Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)Â is facing a serious funding shortfallÂ of $2 billion.
According to Axios, ICE has warned Congress it faces a massive black hole in its budget that could compromise its ability to carry out Trumpâ€™s flagship immigration policy.
Although Congress will send an additional $500 million in the stop-gap spending bill that just passed the House, that money would still fall well short of providing the funds ICE needs to continue working at its current pace through September.
Current plans for ICE expansion include the hiring of hundreds more stuff, the doubling of detention space to accommodate 100,000 people and increasing the number of detention flights.
The spending plan now before Congress is â€œnot going to be sufficient to be able to cover the entire need for what theyâ€™re coveringâ€ at ICE, said Sen. James Lankford
â€œJust the bed space alone becomes very significant. And to just be able to detain people for a couple of days while theyâ€™re processing, and then to be able to move out flightsâ€¦ is exceptionally expensive.â€
It may be possible to divert money to ICE from other agencies within the Department of Homeland Security, such as FEMA and the Coast Guard, but this could only be a temporary measure.

title: Trump Boom: 228,000 Jobs Added in March
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Employers in the US added 228,000 new workers to their payrolls in March, according to figures released by the Department of Labor on Friday.
The figures significantly exceeded expectations. Economists reckoned 140,000 jobs would be added in March, nearly 90,000 fewer than the eventual figure.
Workforce participation climbed slightly, from 62.4% to 62.5%.
The length of the average workweek also increased, which is a sign of demand for labor.
Average hourly earnings also rose, by 0.3% compared with February and 3.8% compared with a year ago.
The strong figures come as uncertainty about Trumpâ€™s economic policies, and in particular his flagship policy of tariffs, continues.
On Wednesday, President Trump announced a comprehensive new policy of â€œreciprocal tariffsâ€ that would affect the USâ€™s major trading partners and many smaller nations as well.
Trumpâ€™s announcement of the tariffs sent out a global shockwave, causing a record two-day decline in stock-market value of $5 trillion. Prices for oil and commodities plummeted, as investors sought a measure of safety in government bonds.
The 10% baseline tariff took effect at 12.01 am ET on Saturday and represents â€œthe single biggest trade action of our lifetime,â€ according to former White House trade adviser Kelly Ann Shaw.
Among the countries subject to the 10% tariff are Australia, Britain, Colombia, Argentina, Egypt and Saudi Arabia.
At 12.01am ET on Wednesday, Trumpâ€™s higher â€œreciprocalâ€ tariff rates, varying from 11% to 50%, will take effect. Imports from the European Union will face a 20% tariff, while Chinese goods will be subject to an additional 34% tariff, bringing the total Trump has imposed on China to 54%.
Canada and Mexico are exempt from Trumpâ€™s latest duties because they remain subject to an earlier 25% tariff related to the fentanyl and illegal immigration crises. Trump is also excluding goods subject to separate 25% national-security tariffs, which include steel and aluminum, cars, trucks and auto parts.
The new tariffs are expected to force foreign countries to the negotiating table. Vietnam, which was hit with one of the highest tariff ratesâ€”46%â€”has already agreed to discuss new trade terms with Trump.

title: Klaus Schwab Stepping Down as Chair of World Economic Forum
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
World Economic Forum founder and chairman Klaus Schwab is to step down, a spokesperson for the Forum said on Thursday.
Schwab has said the Forum, which meets annually at the Swiss ski resort of Davos, needs to rediscover its â€œsense of mission,â€ in a letter to trustee board members.
In a statement to the Financial Times, the WEF said Schwab would complete the process of stepping down by January 2027.
Schwab indicated his intention to step down last year, saying he would hand over executive duties to a team led by Borge Brende, a former foreign minister of Norway who has been the Forumâ€™s president since 2017. Schwab has spent 54 years at the Forum, since its foundation in 1971.
Controversy has dogged Schwab in recent months. Last year, The Wall Street Journal reported the Forumâ€™s board was working with a law firm to investigate its workplace culture, after allegations of a â€œculture of harassmentâ€ and discrimination at the organization.
In March, the Forum said external lawyers who investigated the claims found it had not committed any legal violations and allegations of misconduct against Schwab himself were not true.
The World Economic Forum and its founder became a lightning rod for popular anger during the pandemic after it declared a â€œGreat Resetâ€ that would transform every aspect of life in every country on the planet.
â€œThe pandemic represents a rare but narrow window of opportunity to reflect, reimagine, and reset our world to create a healthier, more equitable, and more prosperous future,â€ Schwab said in 2020.
World leaders, royalty, celebrities, captains of industry, academics and the media joined Schwabâ€™s call for a â€œGreat Reset.â€
â€œConspiracy theoriesâ€ about the Forum and its role in the pandemic were furiously â€œdebunkedâ€ by the mainstream media.

title: Supreme Court Gives Trump Big Win in DEI Decision, but Roberts Sides with Libs
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
The US Supreme Court sided with the Trump administration on Friday, blocking a district judgeâ€™s order to reinstate $250 million of diversity, equity and inclusivity (DEI) training funds to eight states.
The 5-4 decision, Trumpâ€™s first win at the Supreme Court in his second term, reversed a decision by a district court judge that threw a spanner in the new administrationâ€™s efforts to abolish federal DEI programs.
Last month, US district judge Myong Joun, a Biden appointee, issued a temporary restraining order and told the Trump administration to reinstate grants for teacher training in DEI under the Department of Education.
The Trump administration then filed an appeal, but that was denied by the 1st Circuit Court of Appeals.
Five of the conservative Justices were in the majority, while Chief Justice Roberts, who has clashed with President Trump in recent weeks, chose to side with liberal Justices Kagan, Jackson and Sotomayor.
Tensions between the President and Chief Justice came to a head two weeks ago, over the issue of district judges issuing nationwide orders in an attempt to derail the Trump adminâ€™s flagship policies, including mass deportation and swinging cuts to federal budgets and agencies.
Chief Justice Roberts suggested the President was defying one of the foundational principles of American government by demanding the impeachment of Judge James Boasberg, who attempted to block the deportation of alleged foreign gang members, including members of MS-13,Â using the Alien Enemies Act of 1798.
In response, President Trump issued Chief Justice Roberts a challenge on his social-media platform Truth Social.
â€œIt is our goal to MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN, and such a high aspiration can never be done if Radical and Highly Partisan Judges are allowed to stand in the way of JUSTICE. STOP NATIONWIDE INJUNCTIONS NOW, BEFORE IT IS TOO LATE. If Justice Roberts and the United States Supreme Court do not fix this toxic and unprecedented situation IMMEDIATELY, our Country is in very serious trouble!â€Â TrumpÂ posted.

title: US Begins Collecting 10% Tariffs
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
US customs agents have begun collecting President Donald Trumpâ€™s 10% tariffs on all imports from a number of different countries. Higher levies on goods from almost 60 larger trading partners will come into force next week.
The 10% baseline tariff took effect at 12.01 am ET on Saturday and represents â€œthe single biggest trade action of our lifetime,â€ according to former White House trade adviser Kelly Ann Shaw.
Among the countries subject to the 10% tariff are Australia, Britain, Colombia, Argentina, Egypt and Saudi Arabia.
A 51-day grace period for cargoes loaded onto vessels or planes and in transit to the U.S. before 12:01 a.m. ET Saturday has been allowed. These cargoes need arrive to by 12:01 a.m. ET on May 27 to avoid the 10% duty.
At 12.01am ET on Wednesday, Trumpâ€™s higher â€œreciprocalâ€ tariff rates, varying from 11% to 50%, will take effect. Imports from the European Union will face a 20% tariff, while Chinese goods will be subject to an additional 34% tariff, bringing the total Trump has imposed on China to 54%.
Canada and Mexico are exempt from Trumpâ€™s latest duties because they remain subject to an earlier 25% tariff related to the fentanyl and illegal immigration crises. Trump is also excluding goods subject to separate 25% national-security tariffs, which include steel and aluminum, cars, trucks and auto parts.
The new tariffs are expected to force foreign countries to the negotiating table. Vietnam, which was hit with one of the highest tariff ratesâ€”46%â€”has already agreed to discuss new trade terms with Trump.
Trumpâ€™s announcement of the tariffs on Wednesday sent out a global shockwave, causing a record two-day decline in stock-market value of $5 trillion. Prices for oil and commodities plummeted, as investors sought a measure of safety in government bonds.

title: 1.3 Million Illegals Accessing Medicaid Benefits
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
More than a million illegal immigrants are accessing Medicaid benefits, according to Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) executive Antonio Garcias.
Speaking during an appearance on the All In podcast on X, Garcia revealed how illegal immigrants are accessing medical benefits and even voting.
Garcia claimed 1.3 million illegals are on the Medicaid register at present according to analysisÂ  by DOGE, and that the number would only start â€œrampingâ€ as the waste-cutting department continued its investigation.
DOGE also looked at voter rolls in â€œfriendlyâ€ states and found that thousands of these illegals had registered to vote.
Again, Garcia cautioned that this was just a preliminary estimate, and that further investigation would reveal voter fraudâ€”a federal crimeâ€”in far greater numbers.
â€œItâ€™s the tip of the iceberg. It doesnâ€™t include the 7.8 million people that ICE has that have come in illegally that know weâ€™re here, and all the people that came illegally we donâ€™t know are here. I mean, this is not a political issue. I want to be really clear about this. This is about America.â€

title: Obama Judge Orders Suspected MS-13 Member To Be Returned to US from El Salvador, White House Responds
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
An Obama judge ordered a suspected MS-13 gang member to be returned to the US from El Salvador, sparking a defiant response from the White House.
On Friday, Judge Paula Xinis ordered the man to be returned to the US by Monday at midnight.
â€œThis was an illegal act,â€ Judge Paula Xinis told a Justice Department lawyer, according toÂ Politico.
â€œCongress said you canâ€™t do it, and you did it anyway.â€
According to the White House, the man in question, Kilmar Abrego Garcia, was a member of the criminal gang MS-13, which has now been designated a terrorist organization. He is said to have been involved in human trafficking. He was apprehended in Maryland last month, before being flown to El Salvador, where he now resides in President Nayib Bukeleâ€™s fearsome CECOT prison.
Judge Xinis, however, said that the accusation of gang membership is â€œjust chatter.â€
â€œIn a court of law, when someone is accused of membership in such a violent and predatory organization, it comes in the form of an indictment, a complaint, a criminal proceeding that has robust process so we can assess the facts,â€ Xinis added.
In response to Judge Xinisâ€™s decision, the White House, via Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt, issued a defiant statement.
â€œWe suggest the Judge contact President Nayib Bukele because we are unaware of the judge having jurisdiction or authority over the country of El Salvador.â€
Rumours that Garcia was not a gang member have been circulating for at least a week. On Tuesday, Leavitt shut down these rumours during a press conference, stating unequivocally that the Trump administration knows Garcia was a member of MS-13 and that he was involved in human trafficking.
â€œThe administration maintains the position that this individual was deported to El Salvador and will not be returning to our country and was a member of the brutal and vicious MS-13 gang.â€

title: Zelensky Says NATO Membership Still In Ukraineâ€™s Future, Contradicting Trump
author: By ZeroHedge
content:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky continues to test President Trump, this time contradicting the US leader on the question of Ukraineâ€™s future membership in NATO.
Trump has clearly taken it off the table, as even NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte has recentlyÂ recognized. But Zelensky in fresh comments said he has not given up on Ukraineâ€™s pursuit of NATO accession.
â€œYou know who does not support Ukraineâ€™s membership in NATO so far, but in any case,Â no one is removing this issue from the table for the future,â€ Zelensky said, as quoted inÂ UkrinformÂ news agency on Friday.
â€œAt least, we are talking about the fact that even if now someone does not want to support [Kiev joining the bloc], we will see what happens in the future,â€ Zelensky added.
He went on to explain in the comments that until membership in the Western military bloc happens, Kiev should be provided withÂ â€œNATO-like security guaranteesâ€ by its allies and partners.
Ukraine must be â€œstrong when getting to the negotiating tableâ€ in order to achieve a â€œjust peace,â€ Zelensky said.
Earlier this week, President Trump made clear in reference to Zelensky that â€œhe wants to be a member of NATO.Â Well, he was never going to be a member of NATO. He understands that.â€
The issue of NATO constantly expanding right up to Russiaâ€™s borders, which especially ramped up in the mid-2000s during the Bush era, had been consistently identified by President Putin as a key motive in his ordering hundreds of thousands of Russian troops into Ukraine in February of 2022.
Russia saw its â€˜special military operationâ€™ asÂ a continuation of a war in Donbass that was alreadyÂ burning since 2014, which saw CIA and Western intelligence assist Kiev in seeking to push back Russian influence. But the reality has always been that natives on the Donbass are overwhelmingly Russian-speaking and pro-Moscow.
Trump also this week while speaking to reporters aboard Air Force One that negotiations have produced â€œa lot of good conversations about Ukraine and Russia.â€
Ukraine joining NATO, as our president said, is â€œnot at all possible,â€Â says Putin envoy Kirill Dmitriev. â€œThat, I think, has been widely accepted, including by the Trump administration.â€
Ukraine joining NATO, as our president said, is NOT AT ALL POSSIBLE â€” Dmitriev 'That, I think, has been widely accepted, including by the Trump administration' https://t.co/ZXuezRJdJL pic.twitter.com/rpxUJUC0PP

title: German Priest Calls Altar Boy a â€˜Naziâ€™ And Fires Him After He Takes Photo With AFD Politician Maximilian Krah
author: By Staff | Remix
content:
An altar boy who served in a Bavarian church for nine years was slammed as a â€œNaziâ€ by the parish priest and dismissed from his position after the boy took a photo with Alternative for Germany (AfD) politician Maximilian Krah.
The family says they are shocked by the conduct of the Bavarian priest.
The church, in the Regen district, is now under fire for its conduct in the case. The parents have even written an open letter that their boy was very interested in politics and had attended various campaign events during the election campaign. At an AfD event, he took a photo with Krah and posted it on his WhatsApp channel.
This reportedly infuriated the priest who called the boy into a meeting, where he allegedly called him a â€œNaziâ€
â€œIf you think like a Nazi, talk like a Nazi, and act like a Nazi, are you not a Nazi?â€ the priest allegedly said. He added that as a Christian, the boy cannot support the AfDâ€™s positions.
The AfDâ€™s Krah has already responded to the incident, writing on X; â€œThe German church tax church has long been post-Christian, often anti-Christian. The boy is now learning this the hard way. I hope his faith will become even stronger as a result. I will try to contact him.â€
The priest then dismissed the youth from his service, despite the boyâ€™s nearly decade of service and his very religious nature. He had even considered becoming a priest himself.
â€œSince the end of January, our sonâ€™s world and that of our family have been thrown into disarray,â€ the Passauer Neue Presse wrote, the paper which broke the story, while quoting the family in a letter they wrote.
The Diocese of Passau has confirmed the incident. The diocese declared that the Church of Passau stands for â€œa liberal, democratic basic order.â€ However, the diocese still wants to â€œremain in dialogue with people who sympathize with problematic political positions.â€
According to the diocese, the boy has been â€œoffered several times to return to the circle of altar boys.â€ However, according to the diocese, the family has not yet accepted this offer.
Both the Protestant and Catholic churches in Germany have gone to war with the AfD, and have evenÂ removed priests who sympathized with the party. These churches have been shedding members by the hundreds of thousands every year, as Germans grow more and more disenchanted with Christianity in the country.

title: The Western Elitesâ€™ War Against Democracy is Now Out in the Open
author: By Mick Hume | The European Conservative
content:
The French authorities insist that the conviction of Marine Le Pen, which disqualifies the leader of the National Rally (RN) from standing for election as president of France, is not political. No, they say, it simply reflects the neutral â€˜rule of lawâ€™ and the â€˜independence of the judicial system.â€™
Really? Strange then, that supposedly â€˜independentâ€™ judges and officials across Europe and America have all reached remarkably similar verdicts against right-wing politicians.
It looks less like judicial independence and the old-fashioned rule of law than a globalist establishment plot to use the courts as a political weapon against the rising national populist revolt.
The serious fraud here is not Le Penâ€™s party allegedly embezzling EU funds. It is the liberal elitesâ€™ fraudulent claim that they are defending democracyâ€”by denying people the freedom to vote for whom they choose.
The one thing which all these unelected judges are truly â€˜independentâ€™ of is any democratic accountability for their actions. Their politicised version of the â€˜rule of lawâ€™ is a denial of the rule of the people.
It is now undeniable that the Western establishment is hiding behind the law while waging a political war against popular democracy. The high-profile show trial of Marine Le Pen confirms that their anti-democratic crusade is now being conducted out in the open. It is time for us all to take sides, and take a stand.
You do not need to be an expert in jurisprudence or a conspiracy theorist to see the obvious pattern of political judgements against national conservative politicians across the West.
So, French judges have just convicted Le Pen and thus ruled her out of running in the 2027 presidential election, for which she was easily leading the polls.
This judgement, media supporters of the EU establishment will try to tell us, is of course entirely unconnected to the rulings of the Romanian courts, which cancelled their presidential election after right-wing nationalist Calin Georgescu won the first round, and then barred him from standing again.
Those Romanian verdicts have been upheld by the European Court of Human Rights, which we know is also completely â€˜independentâ€™ of the wishes of any voter in any European nation.
None of this, they will insist, has anything to do with events in Germany, where court judgements that brand the populist Alternative fur Deutschland guilty of being far-right extremists have emboldened other parties to call for an outright ban on the AfD, which is now the choice of millions of German voters and vying for national leadership in the polls.
There are many other similar examples of state and European courts trying to obstruct or outlaw national-populist parties and politicians, from Italy and Poland to Slovenia. Meanwhile the EU courts continue to target Hungaryâ€™s elected conservative government as if it was Europeâ€™s most-wanted criminal conspiracy.
On the EUâ€™s doorstep, the UK Labour governmentâ€”led by former top state prosecutor Sir Keir Starmerâ€”has cancelled local elections due to take place in several English counties next month, denying more than five million Brits their right to vote. Labour insists of course that this suspension of democracy is a purely technical matter, to do with their plans to reorganise regional government; we are expected to believe that it has nothing at all to do with the fact that Nigel Farageâ€™s insurgent Reform UK was expected to win in several of the counties where elections have been cancelled.
And the war on democracy doesnâ€™t stop at Europeâ€™s borders. Across the Atlantic, Donald Trump had to defeat various courtsâ€™ campaigns to discredit and disbar him before he could stand for re-election as U.S. president. Since he won that election and assumed office in January, President Trumpâ€™s radical reformsâ€”from stopping USAID spending to slashing government wasteâ€”have repeatedly been balked by a collection of politically liberal district court judges. These entitled pygmies of the legal system appear to assume that they should have more authority over U.S. affairs than a leader doing what he was elected to do by more than 77 million Americans.
Call me an old cynic, but I find it hard to swallow that this is all a series of coincidences. If something looks and sounds this much like a campaign of political lawfare against populist politicians across the West, then thatâ€™s almost certainly what it is.
Conservatives have of course always supported the rule of law as the basis of a stable and secure society. It is time to accept, however, that the â€˜rule of lawâ€™ the authorities call on today no longer means what it did. It amounts instead to the rule of a politicised judiciary, acting as the agents of liberal globalist elites.
For their part, exhausted old Western political elites which now lack the authority or support to rule confidently in their own names are hiding behind the â€˜rule of lawâ€™ and the grandeur of the judiciary. Fearful of the electorate and unable to combat the rising populist revolt, they instead seek to outlaw the opposition.
These judges are no longer â€˜above politics.â€™ We are witnessing politics being brought into the courts as never before in the modern West. And in the process, big political battles are being removed from the arena of democratic debate.
What does Western democracy really mean if voters are denied their choice of candidates, or those elected are denied the chance to fulfil their promises to the electorate?
As I have argued onÂ europeanconservative.comÂ before, these questions come back to the origins of the concept of democracy in ancient Athens, as a marriage of theÂ demosâ€”the peopleâ€”andÂ kratosâ€”power or control. The aim of the oligarchy is always to keep those two as far apart as possible, to maintain its monopoly on power. The increasing concentration ofÂ kratosÂ in the courts is the clearest case of the anti-democratic instincts of Western oligarchs.
Outrageous assaults such as the Le Pen show trial may well backfire and lead to a further upsurge in support for national populists. People do not like being told who they are allowed to vote for. The populist revolt against the old order cannot be ended by the stroke of a judgeâ€™s pen. But we have yet to see just how far the establishment is prepared to go to contain the threat to its power.
It is time for all those who want a chance to shape the future of a free Europe to take a stand and fully embrace the populist revolt. Democracy remains our one hope of challenging the globalist elites who have taken control of Western institutions, from the courts to the universities.
The stakes are high. As Frank Furedi argues elsewhere onÂ europeanconservative.comÂ this week, theÂ West is in crisis as the old world order is pulled apart. It is time to decide what we stand for and what it is that we want to defend. Reclaiming and advancing the founding principles of democracy, popular sovereignty, and free speech will be key to securing the future.
That is why, when it comes to the confrontation between state or EU courts and national populist politicians, we must say without conditions: Je Suis Marine, Donald, Viktor, or whoever is next in the legal firing line. The war for Western democracy is now one in earnest. No surrender.

title: Democrats, Former Disinfo Board Chief, Defend Government-Big Tech Ties, Dismiss Censorship-Industrial Complex at House Hearing on First Amendment Safeguards
author: By Didi Rankovic | Reclaim The Net
content:
Nina Jankowicz â€“ former head of the disbandedÂ Disinformation Governance BoardÂ and CEO of the American Sunlight Project â€“ and Democrats who this week spoke during a House Foreign Affairs Committee hearing, continued to deny and defend the Big Tech-government censorship collusion.
The hearing â€“ â€œCensorship-Industrial Complex: The Need for First Amendment Safeguards at the State Departmentâ€ â€“ also saw Jankowicz, who appeared as a witness, and Representative Sydney Kamlager-Dove, a Democrat, attempt to paint the actions taken by the new Trump White House as worse that what was happening during the previous US administration.
Both Jankowicz and Kamlager-Dove referred to the system known as the Censorship-Industrial Complex, and its elements, as â€œfiction,â€ â€œlies,â€ â€œtall tales,â€ and, â€œa conspiracy theory,â€ with Jankowicz trying to frame the new governmentâ€™s moves as â€œan assault on the First Amendmentâ€ and â€œsuppressing speech.â€
Despite the fact these are some of the key accusations against the Biden administration â€“ and at this point, fairly well backed up by batches of internal documents, but also testimonies from Big Tech execs â€“ Jankowicz chose to call it â€œthe imagined actions of the Biden administration.â€
As for her own role in this â€œimaginedâ€ system â€“ namely, the brief stint at the helm of the short-lived Disinformation Governance Board (that was part of the Department of Homeland Security) â€“ Jankowicz maintained that it was not meant to be a censorship body.
Instead, Jankowicz would have the Committee and the public believe the Board was true to its mission statement, which was â€œto protect civil rights, civil liberties, privacy, and the First Amendment.â€
(DHSâ€™Â Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency(CISA) also had a reasonable mission statement â€“ to protect critical infrastructure from cyberattacks â€“ only to then, according to the findings of the House Judiciary Committee, switch to surveillance and censorship of Americansâ€™ online speech.)
Jankowicz tried to dismiss the validity, and value of the Twitter Files, which have proven to be crucial in shedding light on the inner workings of the â€œfictitiousâ€ Censorship-Industrial Complex.
But to her mind, theÂ Twitter FilesÂ are â€œalmost endless fictionâ€ and, somehow â€“ â€œa conspiracy.â€
Another place where â€œno censorship was going onâ€ was the State Departmentâ€™s Global Engagement Center, the Foreign Affairs Committee heard from Jankowicz.
And, she doesnâ€™t detect any problems with the scandalous actions taken by the former government to suppress the Hunter Biden laptop story, suggesting that Twitter â€œadding frictionâ€ resulted in â€œmore views.â€

title: Trumpâ€™s New NIH Head Fires Top Fauci Allies And Covid Shot Promoters, Including Fauciâ€™s Wife

content:
BETHESDA, Maryland (LifeSiteNews) â€” On day one of his new job as head of the National Institutes of Health (NIH), Dr. Jay Bhattacharya removed four powerful agency heads, including Dr. Anthony Fauciâ€™s wife, Christine Grady, and others associated with the questionable handling of the COVID-19 shots.
Grady, who had served as chief of the agencyâ€™s Department of Bioethics, and other longtime Fauci allies in top posts at the NIH involved in the development and distribution of the untested COVID shots produced by Big Pharma were offered jobs in Alaska and other remote locales far away from the NIHâ€™s sprawling Bethesda, Maryland, complex just outside Washington, D.C.
The purge came amid massive layoffs in health-related agencies under the umbrella of Health and Human Services (HHS), now headed by the Make America Healthy Again (MAHA) movementâ€™s founder, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., who has long questioned vaccine safety and American medicineâ€™s focus on treating disease rather than preventing it.
A total of about 20,000 personnel â€“ mostly bureaucrats â€“ or about 25 percent of the HHS workforce have been or will be handed pink slips amidÂ Kennedyâ€™s realignmentof the agency.
MAHA critics were quick to call Tuesdayâ€™s axing of Fauci confederates as â€œone of the darkest days in modern scientific historyâ€ fueled by Kennedyâ€™s desire toÂ exact revengeÂ on Fauciâ€™s former trusted associates who represent the antithesis of the MAHA movement.
However, the revamping of the federal governmentâ€™s side of the health industry is no more harsh than the treatment meted out by those formerly in control who, at best, suppressed, and worst, punished those who questioned their iron grip on health-industry regulations and standards.
For years, Kennedyâ€™s critics have dismissed his quest to revamp healthcare and his questioning of the efficacy of the COVID-19 mRNA jabs as anti-science, labeling him as an â€œanti-vaxxerâ€ in order to suppress his messaging.
Dr. Francis Collins â€“ whom Bhattacharya replaced as head of NIH â€“ in an October 2020 email to Fauci condemned Bhattacharya as a â€œfringe epidemiologistâ€ because he had co-authored theÂ Great Barrington Declaration,Â which criticized harmful COVID lockdown policies.
â€œDuring the pandemic Fauciâ€™s bioethicist wife, Christine Grady, offered nurses a choice: Get vaccinated, or lose your job,â€Â notedÂ The COVID-19 History Project on X.
â€œYesterday, she was offered a choice: Transfer to an office in Alaska, or lose your job. Whatâ€™s fair is fair. Everyone deserves a choice,â€ explained the COVID watchdog account.
During the pandemic Fauci's bioethicist wife, Christine Grady, offered nurses a choice: Get vaccinated, or lose your job. Yesterday, she was offered a choice: Transfer to an office in Alaska, or lose your job. What's fair is fair. Everyone deserves a choice. pic.twitter.com/TG55yICr1I
â€œWe spend 4X more than Italy on healthcare â€” and live 7 years less. Dead last in cancer rates. This isnâ€™t science â€” itâ€™s a system profiting off sick kids,â€Â explainedCalley Means, RFK Jr. HHS advisor during an interview with Laura Ingraham following the NIH firings.
â€œFiring the people who oversaw this? Thatâ€™s step one,â€ declared Means.
â€œWe spend 4X more than Italy on healthcareâ€”and live 7 years less. Dead last in cancer rates. This isnâ€™t scienceâ€”itâ€™s a system profiting off sick kids. Firing the people who oversaw this? Thatâ€™s step one.â€â€“ @CalleyMeans, RFK Jr. HHS advisor pic.twitter.com/z42amlRu3k
Other NIH officials who were offered reassignments were Dr. Jeanne Marrazzo, who succeeded Fauci as head of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID), Dr. Clifford Lane, a close Fauci ally who served as deputy director for clinical research at NIAID, and Dr. Emily Erbelding, NIAIDâ€™s microbiology and infectious diseases director.

title: Macron Backs Judiciary Over Le Pen Ban
author: By Michael Curzon | The European Conservative
content:
Any hopes Marine Le Pen might have for theÂ appealÂ against her ban from running for office cannot have been inspired by Emmanuel Macron, who is usually keen toÂ demonstrateÂ his love of democracy, yet on this occasion has been noticeably short of words.
On Wednesday, the president broke his public silence on what has widely been viewed as aÂ partisan decisionÂ to remove the National Rally (RN) leader from the political stage, opting simply to defend the â€œindependentâ€ judiciary without commenting on the rights or wrongs of the ban itself.
An official present at a meeting with top government officials said Macron also stressed that â€œâ€‹â€‹judges must be protected,â€ after it was revealed that the figure who barred Le Pen from running in Franceâ€™s 2027 presidential election is now under police protection.
Already, RN President Jordan Bardella has come under fire for organising a rally in defence of Le Pen. He told reporters at the European Parliament that â€œitâ€™s not a power play.â€
On the contrary, it is a very clear and very deep defence of the rule of law and of French democracy.
Macron has so far been unable to issue a defence of democracy of his own since the ruling on Monday, beyond bland statements including â€œthe law is the same for everyoneâ€ and â€œall defendants have the right to legal recourse.â€ This despite his own prime minister, Francois Bayrou, declaring that he was â€œtroubledâ€ by the courtâ€™s decision.
The Paris Court of Appeal will deliver its ruling on Le Penâ€™s appealÂ next year.

title: WATCH: Top Adviser To RFK Jr. Spars With Big Pharma Lobbyists In Explosive Interview
