title: Online Anonymity Could End in Belgium With The Introduction of MANDATORY Digital ID, Similar Moves Seen Across EU
author: By Staff | Remix
content:
Electronic identification cards, known as eIDs, have been available in Belgium for many years â€“ since 2003, in fact. Until now, however, they have always been optional. Now, the Belgian government has become yet another country to consider making them a requirement for their citizens to use social media.
All Belgian citizens over the age of 12 are required to have a national ID card. An eID is one option to fulfill this requirement. eID cards are already required in order to access certain government services online.
Belgiumâ€™s ID cards have been upgraded several times over the years. In 2020, the ownerâ€™s fingerprints became a mandatory inclusion on all such cards, for example.
It was announced earlier this month that citizens will soon be able to request digital versions of their ID cards that they can use on smartphones by Nov. 26. The new form of the ID will be accepted not only for identification purposes but also for online authentication, electronic signatures, and for travel between countries within the Schengen Zone.
Minister of the Interior Bernard Quintin stressed that the use of the digital ID will remain optional and that existing eID cards will still be valid.
Last week, however, it was reported by the Belgian newspaperÂ Het Laatste NieuwsÂ that the countryâ€™s new minister of public modernization, civil service, public enterprises, digitization, and buildings administration, Vanessa Matz, is considering making digital ID mandatory for using social media. The newspaper said that this suggestion appears in a policy note issued by Matz.
Caroline Gennez, who is the current Flemish minister of welfare, praised the idea. â€œIt is becoming increasingly clear that social media has a negative impact on the well-being of our children and young people,â€ she said, as reported by Het Laatste Nieuws. â€œThere they are confronted with completely unrealistic ideals about beauty, images of brutal violence and sexual abuse, fake news, and hate speech.â€
â€œWe need to intervene,â€ Gennez added. â€œIn real life, we find it perfectly normal to set boundaries and introduce age restrictions to protect our children and young people. Why should it be different in the digital world?â€
The minister did not address the obvious privacy issues that would arise from such legislation, despite the fact that a mandatory ID check would render online anonymity impossible for citizens of all ages.
Other European countries are considering making a digital ID mandatory for social media use as well. Last month Franceâ€™s Minister of Justice GÃ©rald Darmanin said that he will be looking into such a scheme for French Internet users in the coming weeks, as previously reported byÂ Remix News.

title: UK MP Questions Whether Elon Musk and JD Vanceâ€™s Criticism of Censorship Laws May Constitute â€œForeign Interferenceâ€
author: By Cam Wakefield | Reclaim The Net
content:
At first glance, you might think Emily Darlington, Labour MP for Milton Keynes Central, had simply woken up on the wrong side of a particularly Orwellian bed. During a recent parliamentary inquisition â€” sorry,Â hearingÂ â€” on social media, misinformation, and algorithms, Darlington floated an idea so alarmingly daft that even the Ministry of Truth would have blushed.
Her proposal? That public criticism of the UKâ€™s speech laws byÂ Elon MuskÂ andÂ US Vice President JD VanceÂ might amount to â€œforeign interference.â€ Thatâ€™s right. According to Darlingtonâ€™s logic, if an American so much as questions theÂ Online Safety Act, they might as well be stuffing ballot boxes or hacking government servers.
â€œShould we consider the current JD Vance, Elon Musk campaign against the UK â€” particularly against the government and the Prime Minister â€” and this push about free speech and the misrepresentation of our free speech laws as foreign interference?â€ she asked, in a sentence so brazenly bonkers it should come with its own government warning label.
This wasnâ€™t a discussion about cyberattacks or deepfake election manipulation. No, Darlington was talking about speech. Dissent. Opinions. The sort of thing democracies used to be quite fond of.
Now, under the UKâ€™s freshly unwrapped National Security Act 2023, â€œforeign interferenceâ€ can land you 14 years in prison and an unlimited fine. It used to be that such punishments were reserved for actual enemies of the state â€” spies, saboteurs. Now, apparently, tweeting that Britainâ€™s Online Safety Act is a bad idea could get you tossed into the Tower.
One would expect a room full of educated adults to respond to this with a firm, resounding no. Instead, we got caution, hedging, and a heavy whiff of complicity.
Dr. Eirliani Abdul Rahman, a Senior Fellow at Georgetown and one-time Twitter Trust and Safety Council member, refused to outright dismiss the idea that Musk or Vance might be causing harm.
â€œI think there is some grounds there that, because, for example, we can show thereâ€™s harm,â€ she said. â€œFor example, with the riots, he said, Elon Musk said that this is, the civil war is inevitableâ€¦ So in terms of, say, itâ€™s not causal, but you can show by timestamps what happenedâ€¦â€
In other words: we canâ€™t prove anything, but if you squint hard enough and ignore causality, it sort of looks incriminating. Like blaming a pothole on climate change because both happened on a Tuesday.
And then came the piÃ¨ce de surveillance: â€œYou should have every right to legislate it the way you want because youâ€™re protecting your country, your own sovereignty.â€
Ah yes, sovereignty. The catch-all cloak for every anti-democratic impulse. Want to censor Americans? Sovereignty. Want to monitor thought crimes with AI? Sovereignty. Want to classify criticism as sedition? You guessed it: sovereign self-care.
Enter Lyric Jain, CEO of the surveillance tech firm Logically, a company so deep in the governmentâ€™s pockets it probably answers emails in MI5 lingo. Asked about Musk and Vance, Jain did the classic political sidestep; say nothing about specifics and pivot to platitudes about safety.
â€œEach country does have to make a determination on what its sensitivities are,â€ he said, before launching into a baffling sales pitch for behavioral surveillance. â€œLooking at behaviors can be quite technical. It can be quite clinical. We donâ€™t need to get into, really, debates around freedom of expression.â€
Speech is messy. Feelings get hurt. People shout. But behavior? Behavior can be measured. Modeled. Monetized.
Committee Chair Chi Onwurah tried to strike a more moderate tone. But in her attempt to balance the scales, she simply reinforced the core problem: a belief that speech online is no different than shouting in a town square.
â€œWe also support the UKâ€™s sovereignty as a sovereign nation and the laws that apply offline now apply online,â€ she said.
Whoâ€™s really interfering in the UKâ€™s democratic processes? Is it Musk and Vance, tweeting criticisms of its free speech record? Or is it the British MPs and bureaucrats using taxpayer money to build a surveillance and speech regime that treats criticism as criminal?
Is it the foreigners with opinions, or the homegrown censors writing laws with more loopholes than a magicianâ€™s contract?
This latest stunt by Parliament is less about security and more about silencing. Itâ€™s a state quietly muttering, â€œWe believe in freedom,â€ while reaching for the duct tape.

title: US-Russia Talks Begin in Saudi Arabia
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
US and Russian representatives have begun talks in Saudi Arabia aimed at bringing to an end the Russia-Ukraine war.
The US is seeking a separate maritime ceasefire deal to cover the Black Sea, before securing a wider agreement. A maritime ceasefire would allow a return to normal shipping on the Black Sea. Military operations in the area have been significantly reduced in recent months.
In 2022, a deal was struck to allow the export of precious Ukrainian grain via the Black Sea, but Russia withdrew from the agreement in 2023, claiming that the export of its own goods, including grain and fertilizer, was being hampered.
White House National Security adviser Mike Waltz said the talks will also consider the boundaries of a ceasefire, peacekeeping and the return of Ukrainian children taken into Russia during the war.
The American delegation in Riyadh is being led by Andrew Peek, a senior director at the White House National Security Council, and Michael Anton, a senior official in the State Department.
Russia, meanwhile, is represented by Grigory Karasin, a former diplomat and now chair of the Foreign Affairs Committee, and Sergei Beseda, an advisor to the Federal Security Service.
President Donald Trump has said he is satisfied with the progress of talks so far. On Saturday, he said efforts to stop further escalation in the conflict were â€œsomewhat under control.â€
Although European powers are worried Putin will be emboldened by any US-mediated deal, special envoy Steve Witkoff, who met Putin in early March, played down such concerns.
â€œI just donâ€™t see that he wants to take all of Europe. This is a much different situation than it was in World War Two,â€ Witkoff told Fox News.
â€œI feel that he wants peace.â€

title: Maryland Faces First Amendment Battle Over Satirical Meme Account Targeting Governor Wes Moore
author: By Regina Morrison | Reclaim The Net
content:
Thereâ€™s a certain poetic symmetry to the fact that in the year 2025 â€” when most political discourse feels like it was cobbled together from a Reddit thread and a group chat full of GIFs â€” one of the most hotly-debated free speech battles is being fought over a meme account named NoMoore.
The state of Maryland now finds itself at the epicenter of a First Amendment showdown.
The â€œvillainâ€ â€” is NoMoore, a pseudonymous social media account with a gift for satire and criticism, a talent for trolling, and a distinctly unfiltered opinion about Governor Wes Moore.
Among their many visual masterpieces: Moore at a presidential podium rebranded with the word â€œNOPE,â€ and a delightful image of hundred-dollar bills raining around him like itâ€™s his birthday in a hedge fund. This, apparently, references a Baltimore Sun story on a $1 billion business tax proposal, though the vibe is more Scrooge McDuck than an economic policy brief.
Naturally, NoMoore has opinions. And they are not subtle.
The Maryland Democratic Party, perhaps tired of being memeâ€™d into oblivion, has filed a formal complaint, arguing that NoMoore is not just a garden-variety critic, but potentially engaging in campaign activityâ€”and thus, should be regulated under state election law.
This is where the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) enters stage left, the Constitution in one hand, and historical receipts in the other.
Aaron Terr, who speaks for FIRE with the calm fury of someone whoâ€™s read too much case law, said: â€œThe First Amendment is at its strongest and most essential when protecting speech about public officials and public affairs.â€ He added, â€œAnonymous political speech has been a cornerstone of American democracy since the Federalist Papers.â€
This is a question of whether anonymous criticism of public officials can survive in a world where everything is tracked, tagged, and litigated.

title: ICE Close To Cutting Deal with IRS for Illegalsâ€™ Tax Data
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is close to making a deal with the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to allow access to tax data provided by illegal immigrants.
According to The Washington Post, there have been â€œweeks of negotiationsâ€ thus far.
Under the draft agreement being considered, ICE would be able to submit names and addresses of suspected illegals to the IRS to cross-reference with confidential databases, sources confirmed.
Normally, tax information, including names and addresses, is considered confidential. Unlawfully disclosing tax information carries civil and criminal penalties.
â€œHowever, tax information may be shared with other federal law enforcement under certain, limited conditions â€” and typically with approval from a court,â€ The Post Notes.
â€œIt would be unusual, if not unprecedented, for taxpayer privacy law exceptions to be used to justify cooperation with immigration enforcement.â€
The requests would have to be submitted directly by Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem or Acting ICE Director Todd Lyons.
Itâ€™s estimated that around 50% of all illegal aliens in the US are paying taxes to the IRS. In 1999, the IRS encouraged illegal aliens to obtain individual taxpayer identification numbers and to pay tax, on the promise that their data would not be shared with immigration authorities. The move was part of a broader effort to ensure tax compliance among those who are ineligible for a social-security number.

title: Trump Admin Cuts Funding of AUSTRALIAN Universities That Promote Gender Ideology
author: By Jonathon Van Maren | Lifesite
content:
(LifeSiteNews) â€” According to theÂ Guardian, the U.S. government has cut off research funding at six Australian universities, including Monash University, Australian National University, the University of Melbourne, the University of Sydney, the University of South Wales, and the University of Western Australia. The reason? The Trump administration has informed researchers that the â€œtemporaryâ€ funding pause was due to the new U.S. policy of avoiding â€œDEI, woke gender ideology, and the green new deal.â€
These details emerged from a memo sent to one of the universities, which was viewed by theÂ Guardian. ItÂ reads:
Financial assistance should be dedicated to advancing Administration priorities, focusing taxpayer dollars to advance a stronger and safer America, eliminating the financial burden of inflation for citizens, unleashing American energy and manufacturing, ending â€˜wokenessâ€™ and the weaponization of government, promoting efficiency in government, and Making America Healthy Again. The use of Federal resources to advance Marxist equity, transgenderism, and green new deal social engineering policies is a waste of taxpayer dollars that does not improve the day-to-day lives of those we serve.
The funding pause comes while each project is vetted via a â€œcomprehensive analysisâ€ to ensure that the presidentâ€™s executive orders â€“ including those on gender ideology â€“ are being complied with.
â€œIn the interim, to the extent permissible under applicable law, Federal agencies must temporarily pause all activities related to obligation or disbursement of all Federal financial assistance, and other relevant agency activities that may be implicated by the executive orders, including, but not limited to, financial assistance for foreign aid, nongovernmental organizations, DEI, woke gender ideology, and the green new deal,â€ the memo stated.
According to Universities Australia CEO Luke Sheehy, the funding pause indicates a â€œworrying trendâ€ from the â€œbiggest foreign partner we haveâ€ and that the U.S. â€œis looking like its becoming unreliable.â€ American funding for research projects amounted to over $400 million in 2024, which is â€œequivalent to around half the funding the federal [Australian] government provided in research grants via the Australian Research Council.â€
Ironically, theÂ GuardianÂ reported that earlier this month, â€œthe Trump administration wasÂ accused of â€œblatant foreign interferenceâ€Â in Australiaâ€™s universities after researchers who receive US funding were sent a questionnaire asking to confirm they aligned with US government interests.â€ In short, many researchers appear to feel that they are entitled to American funding regardless of whether the research being funded is in the American or, indeed, even the public interest. Some of the research, particularly medical research, clearly qualifies. But the idea that it is â€œforeign interferenceâ€ for funders to ask for details on how those funds are being used exposes the extent to which the U.S. taxpayer has been viewed as a cash cow by international institutions.
The funding cuts arenâ€™t just happening abroad. The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has terminated over 500 research grants related to DEI and transgender ideology. Hundreds of National Institutes of Health (NIH) research grants, worth over $350 million, have been canceled, including,Â according to Fox News, projects focusing on â€œmultilevel and multidimensional structural racism,â€ â€œgender-affirming therapy in mice,â€ and â€œmicroaggressions.â€ Other transgender research projects were cancelled as well.
The criticisms of these cuts, it must be noted, only flow in one direction. When Democrats appoint ideologically aligned personnel to essential posts and ensure that federal funding is directed towards their priorities, this is considered normal. Conversely, when Republicans do so, it is considered a violation of â€œnorms.â€ In short, â€œnormsâ€ means that regardless of who holds office, progressive priorities continue unabated. The Trump administration appears to have had enough of this double standard.

title: AfD Snubbed Again as Ex-Communist Set to Open Bundestag
author: By IldikÃ³ BÃ­rÃ³ | The European Conservative
content:
Germany is still no country for old AfD men, especially not in the Bundestag.
Or so it seems when one looks at the events unfolding in the Berlin legislature regarding the position of the parliamentâ€™sÂ AltersprÃ¤sidentÂ (president by right of age), a largely symbolic title that gives the holder the right to make the first speech of the new legislative session.
The oldest member of the federal parliament is AfD MP Alexander Gauland (84), who traditionally would be the one to open the newly elected Bundestag when it first convenes on March 25.
However, this will not be the case. The honour will instead be given to far-left Die Linke MP Gregor Gysi, aged 77, who was the leader of the ruling German Socialist Unity Party (SED) in the Communist German Democratic Republic, an effective one-party system.
The issue is not just that AfD has again been snubbed by the parliamentary consensus of the so-called centre-right, the liberals and the Left. This has been the official practice since AfD first entered parliament in 2017. At that time, Wilhelm von Gottberg was the oldest member, but the parliamentary majority changed the rules. Since then, Instead of using ageâ€”traditionally the criterion since 1949â€”the ranking member is now determined by length of service in the Bundestag..
As if this in itself were not sufficiently cringe, the person of Gysi is a major embarrassment,Â asÂ Junge FreiheitÂ reminds us. There is evidence that Gysi used to work for the feared and loathed East German secret police, the Stasi, as an â€œunofficial collaborator,â€ according to Stasi archival documents.
Despite his prominent political role in the GDR, Gysi seamlessly converted himself to a dedicated democrat after the system changed. He entered the Bundestag in 1990 for the SED-PDS (Socialist Unity Party and Die Linkespartei) coalition. In 2002, he resigned his seat to become Berlinâ€™s Senator for Economic Affairs under Governing Mayor Klaus Wowereit (SPD). However, he resigned from that position shortly afterwards and obtained a seat in the Bundestag as the leading candidate of Die Linke in 2005, where he has been a member ever since.
AsÂ Junge FreiheitÂ highlights, while the CDU/CSU has raised no objections to Gysi presiding over the first Bundestag session next week, the AfD is pondering a protest. According to reports, AfD is considering various ways to express their dissatisfaction next Tuesday.
This is the second time in the history of reunified Germany that a former member of the SED (now part of Die Linke) has become the oldest member of the Bundestag. But back in 2004 the CDU/CSU protested strongly against 81-year-old Stefan Heym, who was running on the PDS list only so that the party could nominate the German parliamentâ€™sÂ AltersprÃ¤sident.
Despite the criticism, 21 years ago no one thought of changing the rules of procedure for this reason. The CDU/CSU representatives remained seated after Heymâ€™s speech and remained silent, â€œwhich at the time was considered an unheard-of breach of the unwritten rules of parliamentâ€,Â Junge FreiheitÂ recalled, adding: â€œWeâ€™ll find out on Tuesday whether theyâ€™ll give Gysi a standing ovation this time.â€
Weâ€™ll be watching.

title: ASTROTURFED: AOC-Sanders Rally Full of Professional Protestors
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Sen. Bernie Sanders has claimed his â€œFight Oligarchyâ€ tour with Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez is drawing record crowds. But thereâ€™s just one problemâ€”they packed full of professional protestors, according to detailed analysis of mobile-phone data.
Sanders posted a video on X of his rally in Denver, on Saturday.
â€œThe video speaks for itself,â€ the Senator for Vermont wrote.
â€œ34,000 people out in Denver. Largest political rally there since 2008. The message is clear: NO to authoritarianism. NO to oligarchy. NO to Trumpism. We are ready to fight back.â€
Data analyst Tony Seruga had a different interpretation of the event and others on the â€œFight Oligarchyâ€ tour. He used an algorithm to analyze data from smartphones at the event, and came to the conclusion that the numbers were severely inflated and that many in attendance were professional protestors.
â€œHere we go again, there wereÂ 20,189 devices,â€ Seruga wrote on Twitter.
â€œStill a large crowd but not even close to the 30,000 quoted in Denver newspapersÂ nor theÂ 34,000 quoted by Bernie Sanders and AOC.
â€œ84% of the devices present had attended 9 or more Kamala Harris rallies, antifa/blm, pro-Hamas, pro-Palestinian protests, 31% had attended over 20.â€
Seruga went on to say that further detailed analysis showed that many of these individuals were linked to five activist groupsâ€”Disruption Project, Rise & Resist, Indivisible Project, Troublemakers and the Democratic Socialists of Americaâ€”all of which receive money from ActBlue and three of which are known to have received money from USAID.
GPSâ€”Here we go again, there were 20,189 devices. Still a large crowd but not even close to the 30,000 quoted in Denver newspapers nor the 34,000 quoted by Bernie Sanders and AOC.84% of the devices present had attended 9 or more Kamala Harris rallies, antifa/blm, pro-Hamas,â€¦ https://t.co/zQuvc0ATx5
Indivisible, which has also received millions of dollars from George Soros, have been in the news in recent days for their attempts to unseat Chuck Schumer as Senate Minority Leader.
Indivisible is now calling for Schumer to resign. It hosted an event on Saturday at which attendees will be encouraged to write â€œhappy retirementâ€ cards to the veteran politician.
The groupâ€™s co-executive director Ezra Levin announced the plan to oust Schumer shortly after the funding bill passed, with Schumerâ€™s help: â€œSenator Schumer should step aside as leader. Every Democrat in the Senate should call for him to do so, and begin making plans for new leadership immediately.â€
He added that the wrangling over the spending bill should have been used by Democrats as a â€œrare, precious point of leverage,â€ but â€œSchumer did the opposite. He led the charge to wave the white flag of surrender.â€
The new campaign to oust Schumer drew pointed comment from a White House official, who spoke to The New York Post.
They said: â€œThe Democrats will have an important question to answer in the coming days: Who actually leads their party â€” Schumer or Soros?â€
Indivisible reckons it has 1,600 local chapters and employs at least 10 paid staffers. As The New York Post notes, itâ€™s unclear to what extent they receive â€œordersâ€ from their backers.
A representative of George Soros dismissed the claim that he leads the Democrat Part as â€œa daydream.â€
Indivisible is also coordinating protests against Elon Musk and his work as head of the Department of Government Efficiency, including offering $200 payments to activists to take part in â€œMusk or usâ€-themed protests.
Protests against Musk have descended into violence in recent days, with attacks on Tesla dealerships, charging stations and vehicles.
On Thursday, Attorney General Pam Bondi announced federal charges against three individuals involved in this violence, labelling the protests â€œdomestic terrorism.â€

title: Sanders Issues Surprising Praise for Trump Immigration Policy
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Senator Bernie Sanders sounded much more like his 2016-self as he praised Donald Trumpâ€™s immigration policyâ€”with some caveats.
Sanders appeared on This Week with Jonathan Karl when he was asked whether he thought Trump had done anything right so far. Sanders replied, â€œCracking down on fentanyl, making our borders stronger.â€
â€œLook, nobody thinks illegal immigration is appropriate, and I happen to think we need comprehensive immigration reform, but I donâ€™t think itâ€™s appropriate for people to be coming across the border illegally.â€
Sanders made clear, however, that he doesnâ€™t agree with Trumpâ€™s mass-deportation policy in full, especially not the numbers Trump wants to deport.
â€œHe wants to deport 20 million people who are in this country who are undocumented,â€ Sanders said.
â€œWell, you do that, you destroy the entire country.â€
Sanders went on to quip that Trumpâ€™s â€œbillionaire friends are not going to be picking the crops in California that feed us.â€
â€œThey are not going to work in meatpacking houses. Thatâ€™s what undocumented people are doing.â€
Sanders is currently travelling the nation with New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez as part of their â€œFight Oligarchyâ€ tour, which is directedÂ  at Elon Musk and his efforts to cut government waste with the Department of Government Efficiency.

title: AG Bondi: â€œDomestic Terrorism is Going to Come to a Stop in Our Countryâ€
author: By Raw Egg Nationalist
content:
Attorney General Pam Bondi vowed to bring to an end the wave of â€œdomestic terrorismâ€ gripping America, as she joined Foxâ€™s Maria Bartiromo on â€œSunday Morning Futures.â€
The interview began with Bartiromo asking AG Bondi about the Trump adminâ€™s recent run-in with Obama-appointed Judge James Boasberg, who tried to bring a half to deportations of suspected Venezuelan gang members using the Alien Enemies Act.
â€œThe Supreme Court will get involved,â€ Bondi said.
â€œThis is an out-of-control judge. A Federal judge trying to control our entire foreign policy and he cannot do it.
â€œWe are appealing. We will be in court Monday, again, we will win, we will prevail.â€
Bondi continued by saying that members of the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua, which was targeted by President Trumpâ€™s invocation of the Alien Enemies Act, are â€œnot immigrants.â€
â€œThey are illegal aliens who are committing the most violent crimes you can imagine on Americans,â€ Bondi said.
Today, exclusively on @SundayFutures with @MariaBartiromo, U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi @AGPamBondi spoke about U.S. Federal Judges blocking some of President Trump's Agenda.@FoxNews pic.twitter.com/IfH1yggPEK
Bartiromo then asked about the recent spate of attacks on Tesla dealerships, charging stations and vehicles, and AG Bondi had tough words for all those involved, including the three people who have already been arrested and charged for their part in the attacks.
â€œThese arenâ€™t vandals. These are Molotov cocktails. That could be a weapon of mass destruction,â€ Bondi said.
â€œThe three people in custody right now, they will receive severe and swift consequences, and they are facing up to twenty years in prison. We are not negotiating these. We are not coming off these charges.
â€œThis is domestic terrorism,â€ Bondi continued.
The Attorney General also warned Representative Jasmine Crockett over her calls for â€œattacks on Elon Musk.â€
â€œYet she turns and says, oh, Iâ€™m not calling for violence. Well, she is an elected public official and so she needs to tread very carefully because nothing will happen to Elon Musk,â€ Bondi said.
â€œDomestic terrorism is going to come to a stop in our country,â€

title: The Many Disguises of Socialism
author: By Wanjiru Njoya | Mises Institute
content:
In his book,Â Socialism, Ludwig von Mises warns about the threat posed by socialism to peaceful co-existence and to Western civilization. HeÂ highlightsÂ the â€œdisastrous wars and revolutions, heinous mass murders and frightful catastrophesâ€ that have been caused by socialist policies, a warning that was also sounded by Friedrich von Hayek inÂ The Road to Serfdom.
Mises goes beyond warning about the destructive nature of socialism, going further to draw attention to what heÂ considersÂ â€œthe main issue,â€ which he describes as â€œthe desperate struggle of lovers of freedom, prosperity and civilization against the rising tide of totalitarian barbarism.â€ Socialism is destructive in itself, but more than that it fuels the â€œrising tide of totalitarian barbarismâ€ through its many disguises. There is a persistent belief that socialism is an ideal worth pursuing if we could only work out just the right form that it should take. Part of Misesâ€™s goal inÂ SocialismÂ is to explain the dangers of socialism and help readers to recognize socialism when they see it.
Among its many disguises, socialism cloaks itself in the mantle of ideals that many people value such as the ideals of justice and equality before the law. Speaking of the anthropomorphism that ascribes â€œjusticeâ€ to the distribution of wealth that results from market interactions, Hayek in his essay â€œâ€˜Socialâ€™ or Distributive Justice,â€Â warns:
I believe that â€œsocial justiceâ€ will ultimately be recognized as a will-oâ€™-the-wisp which has lured men to abandon many of the values which in the past have inspired the development of civilization.
Thus, the problem is not simply that many people are beguiled by socialism, but that this causes them to abandon the ideals which civilized societies once held. As HayekÂ writesÂ in â€œThe Origins and Effects of Our Moralsâ€:
[I]t is no exaggeration to say that the central aim of socialism is to discredit those traditional morals which keep us alive.
The traditional principles of morality to which he refers, such as the concept of honesty, are associated with the cultural values of classical liberalism which are now under threat: freedom of contract, freedom of association, free speech, and the right to private property. By undermining these ideals, socialism undermines the very foundations of civilization.
In the contemporary context, the primary disguise of socialism is the ideal of equality. Thomas Sowell describes the tenets of socialism as â€œmake believe equalityâ€â€”the idea that we should create laws and policies that ensure we are,Â in fact, all equalâ€”even though, as Murray RothbardÂ explainsÂ inÂ Egalitarianism as a Revolt against Nature, seeking to make all people, in fact, equal would be a sinister Procrustean goal. As Sowell famously said, â€œNo one is equal to anything. Even the same man is not equal to himself on different days.â€ Yet the concept of â€œequalityâ€ now provides cover for many socialist policies. Most notorious is the concept of â€œdiversity, equity, and inclusion.â€ DEI is based on theories of racialÂ polylogism, which are explicated by reference to explicitly Marxist concepts. Indeed, this is one of the main methods by which Marxist ideals now proliferateâ€”by being subsumed within the intellectual foundations of the latest iteration of socialism.
InÂ Socialism, Mises observes that the central doctrines of Marxism are widely accepted and used as the foundation for all manner of socialist ideologies. MisesÂ explains: â€œAt no point in history has a doctrine found such immediate and complete acceptance as that contained in [Marxism]. The magnitude and persistence of its success is commonly underestimated. This is due to the habit of applying the term Marxist exclusively toÂ formalÂ members of one or other of the self-styled Marxist parties, who are pledged to upholdÂ word for wordÂ the doctrines of Marx and Engelsâ€ while overlooking the extent to which its core constructs have been used as the foundation for â€œequalityâ€ policies.
Equality policies often substitute the notion of racial conflict for Marxist notions of class conflict and disguise their Marxist roots by adopting words like â€œdiversity, equity and inclusivenessâ€ or the new terminology of â€œcommunity, opportunity and belonging.â€ To illustrate the influence of Marxist thought on racial equality debates, a good example is one of the doctrines of MarxismÂ describedÂ by Mises:
[Marxism] denied that Logic is universally valid for all mankind and for all agesâ€¦. Thought, it stated, was determined by the class of the thinkers; was in fact an â€œideological superstructureâ€ of their class interests. The type of reasoning which had refuted the socialist idea was â€œrevealedâ€ as â€œbourgeoisâ€ reasoning, an apology for Capitalism.
Following the same reasoning, critical race theories deny that logic is universally valid for all races. They substitute â€œraceâ€ for â€œclassâ€ directly mapping racial concerns onto Marxist class concerns. They declare that anything written by white people is about â€œwhite interests,â€ is based on â€œwhite reasoning,â€ and is, in fact, an apology for colonialism.
Just as Marxism claims â€œclass conditions thought,â€ so they argue that race conditions thought. They say economics is â€œwhite,â€ having been â€œcreatedâ€ by white economists, therefore, black economists such as Thomas Sowell or Walter E. Williams are merely reflecting â€œwhiteâ€ economics and ought, therefore, to be disregarded by black readers. Their argument is that economics is based on â€œracistâ€ reasoning which does not apply when racial minorities or their antiracist â€œalliesâ€ are in charge. Any counter arguments can, conveniently, be dismissed as â€œwhiteness.â€ It follows that, just asâ€”according to Marxismâ€”the interests of the working class can never be unified with the interests of the bourgeoisie, so the interests of white and black can never be unified.
In thinking of strategies to unmask the many disguises of socialism, we should bear in mind Misesâ€™s caution that we cannot oppose socialism by adopting all the same dogmas as the socialists. Doing so amounts to falling into the socialist trap. A good example of this trap is the attempt to challenge DEI by doing DEI â€œbetter,â€ or opposing the anti-discrimination principle by suggesting new or refined grounds for enforcing the anti-discrimination principle.
For example, some opponents of DEI argue that it is wrong to force an employer to hire anyone based on race, so their solution is to force the employer to hire based on merit. They fail to notice that, in both cases, the use of force has been invoked against the employer, or perhaps they think that as long as we cannot escape the use of state force it would be just as well to deploy that force in a more meritorious direction. They have forgotten the non-aggression standard that the use of state force is wrong. However unattainable that standard may now seem, especially as the size of the government workforce continues to grow, it should still be borne in mind as the goal towards which â€œlovers of freedom, prosperity and civilization,â€ as MisesÂ put it, should continually strive.
Murray Rothbard also addresses this issue inÂ For a New Liberty.Â HeÂ asks: â€œHow can we get from here to there, from our current State-ridden and imperfect world to the great goal of liberty?â€
HeÂ discussesÂ the strategies adopted by Marxists, not, of course, because he agrees in any way with Marxist goals but â€œbecause [Marxists] have been thinking about strategy for radical social change longer than any group.â€ When an ideology becomes as pervasive as socialism now is, it cannot be countered without giving serious thought to the long term implications of immediate policy proposals.

title: Peter Schiff: The Fed is Ignoring the Inflation Crisis
author: By SchiffGold
content:
In his latest podcast, Peter tackles the Fedâ€™s recent decision to hold rates steady, criticizing Chair Jerome Powell for downplaying inflation risks andÂ questioning the central bankâ€™s logicÂ behind future rate cuts. He also addresses the patterns of foreign central banksÂ ditching U.S. Treasuries for gold, rising national debt burdens, and the dangerousÂ misconception that all employment is equally productive.
Peter first analyzes the Fedâ€™s decision to significantlyÂ slow down balance sheet reduction. He sees a clear pivot back toward quantitative easing:
Of course, the Fed should continue to shrink the balance sheet. The balance sheet is much too large. The fact that the Fed is dramatically slowing the rate of reduction, I think itâ€™s just another step in the direction of a return to all out quantitative easing. I think thatâ€™s coming. The reason I think that this is a very dovish move by the Fed has to do with the way in which Powell really dismissed the pickup in inflation as if itâ€™s really no big deal or even denying that it exists and showing that the Fed is still focused on these rate cuts, when in reality they should be hiking rates.
Peter elaborates on the critical difference between rising prices and inflation, cautioning against a narrow focus on CPI statistics. He stresses thatÂ true inflation comes from monetary expansionÂ and increasing credit availability, both of which continue to ramp up:
Prices going up are a result of inflation. You canâ€™t just focus on prices. Again, itâ€™s like looking in the rearview mirror. Youâ€™re going to get into an accident. Itâ€™s the money supply expanding, which is continuing, and credit. Inflation is not just the expansion of the money supply; itâ€™s an expansion of credit because credit can be used as money. You can buy stuff with credit even if you donâ€™t have any money. And so the more credit there is in the economy, the more upward pressure there is on prices.
According to Peter, Powell and the Fed are setting themselves up for future failure by insisting on waiting for inflation to prove permanent before acting. He points out that such a delayed reaction will only exacerbate the inflation issue, noting how the Fed isÂ potentially using tariffs as a scapegoatÂ to deflect blame from its own failed monetary strategies:
I mean, I know this was going to happen: anything that happens, heâ€™s going to say, â€˜Well, I guess it was the tariffs.â€™ Thatâ€™s how the Fed is going to deflect the blame from its own monetary policies and put them onto the tariffs. Thatâ€™s another reason why Trump shouldnâ€™t have done it, because it gives the Fed an excuse and it lets them off the hook because itâ€™s very easy to blame the inflation on tariffs. But if Powell does what he says, just really waits until he can figure out whether the price increases are transitory or whether itâ€™s more permanent, by the time he figures that out, itâ€™s much too late to do anything about it.
Peter concludes by underscoring Powellâ€™s troubling disregard for the distinction between productive jobs in the private sector versus unproductive government employment. He makes clear that treating theseÂ different forms of employmentÂ equally reveals a fundamental lack of economic insight andÂ only worsens inflationary pressures:
Somebody asked Powell, â€˜Are you worried about this composition that too many of the jobs that weâ€™ve created are these government jobs?â€™ Powell basically said no. Powell said that the Fed doesnâ€™t distinguish what kind of job it is: jobs are jobs. He says that from our standpoint, employment is employment; it doesnâ€™t matter where the job is coming from and it doesnâ€™t matter what the person is doing. As far as the Fed is concerned, all jobs are created equal, which is a bunch of nonsense. Does he really believe that? Is he really that ignorant about basic economics? Of course, all jobs are not equal, because a productive private sector job is worth a lot more to the economy than a non-productive government job.

title: â€œMax Volume If Threat Detectedâ€:Â Tesla Adds NewÂ Sentry Mode Security Feature To DeterÂ Unhinged Leftist Attacks
author: By ZeroHedge
content:
The Tesla-focused blogÂ Not a Tesla AppÂ reported that followingÂ last weekâ€™s Q1 2025 All-Hands Meeting,Â Tesla quietly updated the Cybertruckâ€™s webpageÂ to include a new Sentry Mode feature that plays loud music as a deterrent againstÂ unhinged individualsâ€”particularly Democratsâ€”attempting to damage the vehicles.

Enable Sentry Mode to monitor your unattended vehicle or trailer, and automatically activate the alarm, increase the touchscreen brightness, andÂ play music at max volume if a threat is detected.

This latest change appears to build on that, leveraging the Cybertruckâ€™sÂ Superhorn and external speaker, which can already play music when parked via the Boombox feature. title: Former Squad Rep Cori Bushâ€™s Husband Charged With Covid Relief Fraud
author: By Zero Hedge
content:
The husband of former â€œSquadâ€ member and Missouri Congresswoman Cori Bush has been charged with defrauding the US government out of $20,000Â in payments under the Covid-eraÂ Paycheck Protection (PPP) and Economic Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL) programs.
In anÂ indictmentÂ filed in DC federal court, 46-year-old Cortney Merritts is accused of filing fraudulent applications for Covid-relief money andÂ using the proceeds for his â€œpersonal benefit and enjoyment.â€Â Prosecutors say that, on April 3, 2020, Merritts filed an application with the Small Business Administration for an EIDL in the name of a sole proprietorship, Vetted Courier and Logistics. He claimed the business had six employees and gross revenues of $32,000 in the year leading up to the Covid disaster declaration.
One day after receiving cash for that application, Merritt raced back to the federal trough, submitted another application for an EIDL loan and an advance â€” this time for a sole proprietorship under his personal name. Prosecutors say he falsely claimed this business had 10 employees and gross revenues of $53,000 in the 12 months preceding the Covid disaster. That application was declined because the information on the application was nearly identical to what he put on the first one. Merritt also tapped the widely-abused PPP program for a business he claimed to have opened in 2020, saying it had $128,000 in annual revenue. The government says those statements were false.
â€œThis case is being investigated by the U.S. Small Business Administration Office of the Inspector General and the FBI Washington Field Office,â€ said the DOJ in aÂ press release.Â Â Merrittsâ€™ attorney says his client will plead not guilty.Â â€œWe look forward to litigating this case in the courtroom,â€ Justin Gelfand of Margulis Gelfand DiRuzzo & Lambson told theÂ Washington Post. We look forward to watching that too.
Cori Bush breaks her silence two days after her bodyguard husband, Cortney Merritts, was indicted for PPP fraud. https://t.co/XUuUkeAJ9y
While she hasnâ€™t been charged in this matter,Â Bush was previously embroiled in controversy and federal investigations relating to Merritt. Last year, the DOJ, Federal Election Commission and House Committee on Ethics all launched probes into allegations thatÂ Bush had misused Congressional funds by hiring Merritt to provide â€œsecurity servicesâ€Â for her. Part of the controversy sprang from Merrittâ€™s reportedÂ lack of security licensesÂ in either Bushâ€™s congressional district or the Washington DC area. The ethics complaint was dismissed; the status of the FEC and DOJ investigations is not known.
Bush was run out of office in 2024.Â It wasnâ€™t her Marxism that did her in, but ratherÂ her criticism of Israel. Pro-Israel organizations threw millions of dollars behind an Israel-catering Democrat who successfully challenged her in the primary.Â â€œCori Bush has been one of the most hostile critics of Israel since she came to Congress in 2021 and has actively worked toÂ undermine mainstream Democratic supportÂ for the U.S.-Israel relationship,â€ AIPAC told Associated Press.Â The AIPAC-affiliated but opaquely-named United Democracy Project spent almostÂ $9 millionÂ to ensure that Bush was ousted.Â Democratic Majority for IsraelÂ chipped in almost $500,000.
Merritts is just the latest of many who are suddenly finding cops at their door almost five years after their fraudulent Covid-era acts:
